subject: Return node validation results based on requested API version
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6618, 'name': 'Ruby Loo', 'email': 'opensrloo@gmail.com', 'username': 'rloo'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11076, 'name': 'Shivanand Tendulker', 'email': 'stendulker@gmail.com', 'username': 'stendulker'}, {'_account_id': 17998, 'name': 'UFCG OneView CI', 'email': 'ufcg-oneview-ci@lsd.ufcg.edu.br', 'username': 'ufcg-oneview-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 19339, 'name': 'Dell EMC Ironic CI', 'email': 'openstack-ironic-ci@dell.com', 'username': 'openstack-ironic-ci'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:19:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-12-07 15:47:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Shiv, thanks for the patch. I commented in the bug, here's the copy/paste. For the rescue work, please leave the rescue interface in the response for a node validation.

It is a bug, but we won't fix it for these reasons. When I looked at the code for the node validation, we were not removing any of the interfaces (eg 'network' and 'raid') that were associated with certain Bare Metal API versions, so it isn't just storage_interface. I asked on irc [1]. Dmitry said that at this point, given that they are already in the response, we can't really remove them since it could break someone's use case. So going forward, we're going to have to return all the interfaces, even new ones like the rescue_interface. That will keep this response consistent. Although it is inconsistent with the information we return in a response for a node-show, it is too late/hard to try to make it all consistent now.

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-ironic/%23openstack-ironic.2017-12-07.log.html#t2017-12-07T15:26:07"}, {'account_id': 6618, 'date': '2017-12-07 15:47:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2017-12-07 19:14:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thank you Ruby for looking into this. Will abandon the patch.'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2017-12-08 04:29:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

For keeping the API behavior consistent, and avoid any backward compatibility issues, this change is abandoned.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 11:19:55.000000000', 'message': 'Return node validation results based on requested API version

GET /v1/nodes/validate?node=... returns results of storage interace
validation even if client requested Ironic version is less than
1.33. This commit fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I8c8f2715018cea7482e0a3ef353cd23e0eccae78
Closes-Bug: #1736923
'}]
commit_message:
Return node validation results based on requested API version

GET /v1/nodes/validate?node=... returns results of storage interace
validation even if client requested Ironic version is less than
1.33. This commit fixes the issue.

Change-Id: I8c8f2715018cea7482e0a3ef353cd23e0eccae78
Closes-Bug: #1736923

Implements:blueprint listen-all-necessary-notifications
"}, {'created': '2017-10-12 08:53:58.000000000', 'message': "listen to 'compute.instance.resize.confirm.end' event

In one integrated cloud env, there would be many solutions, which would
make the compute resource strongly relocated. Watcher should listen to
all the notifications which represent the compute resource changes, to
update compute CDM. If not, the compute CDM will be stale, Watcher
couldn't work steadily and harmoniously.

Change-Id: I57173f0cce0717aa36c5ff758d972d38013e3ef8
Implements:blueprint listen-all-necessary-notifications
"}, {'created': '2017-10-23 09:02:49.000000000', 'message': "listen to 'compute.instance.resize.confirm.end' event

In one integrated cloud env, there would be many solutions, which would
make the compute resource strongly relocated. Watcher should listen to
all the notifications which represent the compute resource changes, to
update compute CDM. If not, the compute CDM will be stale, Watcher
couldn't work steadily and harmoniously.

Change-Id: I57173f0cce0717aa36c5ff758d972d38013e3ef8
Implements:blueprint listen-all-necessary-notifications

commit_message:
listen to 'compute.instance.resize.confirm.end' event

In one integrated cloud env, there would be many solutions, which would
make the compute resource strongly relocated. Watcher should listen to
all the notifications which represent the compute resource changes, to
update compute CDM. If not, the compute CDM will be stale, Watcher
couldn't work steadily and harmoniously.

Change-Id: I57173f0cce0717aa36c5ff758d972d38013e3ef8
Implements:blueprint listen-all-necessary-notifications

commit_message:
Reduce the calls to heat when downloading config

This removes one of the (expensive) nested resource list calls,
which reduces the time for config download considerably in my
environment (from about a minute to around 12 seconds).

Change-Id: I9b1a02cac9ec2640915df7fec378dea20c41c5c5
Closes-Bug: #1736175

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-01 19:24:21.000000000', 'message': 'Use "poll" or "selects" Eventlet hub for all Swift daemons.

Previously, Swift's WSGI servers, the object replicator, and the
object reconstructor were setting Eventlet's hub to either "poll" or
"selects", depending on availability. Other daemons were letting
Eventlet use its default hub, which is "epoll".

In any daemons that fork, we really don't want to use epoll. Epoll
instances end up shared between the parent and all children, and you
get some awful messes when file descriptors are shared.

Here's an example where two processes are trying to wait on the same
file descriptor using the same epoll instance, and everything goes
wrong:

[proc A] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = 0

[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = -1 EEXIST (File exists)
[proc B] epoll_wait(6, ...) = 1
[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_DEL, 3, ...) = 0

[proc A] epoll_wait(6, ...)

This primarily affects the container updater and object updater since
they fork. I've decided to change the hub for all Swift daemons so
that we don't add multiprocessing support to some other daemon someday
and suffer through this same bug again.

This problem was made more apparent by commit 6d16079, which made our
logging mutex use file descriptors. However, it could have struck on
any shared file descriptor on which a read or write returned EAGAIN.

Change-Id: Ic2c1178ac918c88b0b901e581eb4fab3b2666cfe
Closes-Bug: 1722951
'}]
commit_message:
Use "poll" or "selects" Eventlet hub for all Swift daemons.

Previously, Swift's WSGI servers, the object replicator, and the
object reconstructor were setting Eventlet's hub to either "poll" or
"selects", depending on availability. Other daemons were letting
Eventlet use its default hub, which is "epoll".

In any daemons that fork, we really don't want to use epoll. Epoll
instances end up shared between the parent and all children, and you
get some awful messes when file descriptors are shared.

Here's an example where two processes are trying to wait on the same
file descriptor using the same epoll instance, and everything goes
wrong:

[proc A] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = 0

[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = -1 EEXIST (File exists)
[proc B] epoll_wait(6, ...) = 1
[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_DEL, 3, ...) = 0

[proc A] epoll_wait(6, ...)

This primarily affects the container updater and object updater since
they fork. I've decided to change the hub for all Swift daemons so
that we don't add multiprocessing support to some other daemon someday
and suffer through this same bug again.

This problem was made more apparent by commit 6d16079, which made our
logging mutex use file descriptors. However, it could have struck on
any shared file descriptor on which a read or write returned EAGAIN.

Change-Id: Ic2c1178ac918c88b0b901e581eb4fab3b2666cfe
Closes-Bug: 1722951

commit_message:
Delete the number of queue metadata check

Currently in the tempest plugin, the number of queue metadata will be
forced to check, this is not conducive to the new metadata added. And the
need for verification is not great, so delete it here.

Change-Id: I0a15600a836f609e4b992f8a80ba887e312aa780

commit_message:
Rename base and multinode integration jobs

It seems it wasn't clear enough that the purpose of these jobs was
to test content from project-config, zuul-jobs and openstack-zuul-jobs
exclusively.

As such, rename these and make the description more explicit.

Change-Id: Ib8f6c916b99da5bfe998fec39dcc2e71412f1285

commit_message:
WIP undelete of shard containers plus probe test

This is WIP because it uses a quick hack to persist sysmeta
after a DELETE - this is not yet my favored solution but it
validates the probe test and what is required i.e. shard
state must persist after delete.

see discussion at 'How to delete, and then undelete?' in [1]

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/deep-containers

Change-Id: Ic2397bd966ea6943103f443bee8624c3fbd14870

commit_message:
Add user-show to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the user-show command.

The trove command user-show is now:
    openstack database user show

Change-Id: I92455f1606c8a20b477fdbe66daf98e59cc19fd7
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Delete orphaned shard containers

Introduce basic shard audit that will clean up any
shards whose root container has been deleted.

Change-Id: I790a5948952f9eb60c70980bbea7cfe6579736f8

[{'account_id': 26968, 'date': '2017-10-26 14:42:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-10-26 14:43:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 24863, 'date': '2017-10-26 16:14:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Could you add it in 	releasenotes/notes/.."}, {'account_id': 15100, 'date': '2017-11-30 03:15:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

Would you like to create a new INFINIDAT folder to manage your own code files (infinidat.py). If you want to add a new file in the future or if you want to add a new INFINIDAT series driver. It will easy to control it under the INFINIDAT folder. And your original infinibox driver config don't have to be changed (share_driver = manila.share.drivers.infinidat.InfiniboxShareDriver), If your create your INFINIDAT folder later, the original driver config about share_driver will be changed to manila.share.drivers.infinidat.infinidat.InfiniboxShareDriver"}, {'account_id': 26968, 'date': '2017-11-30 08:15:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 16:

> Would you like to create a new INFINIDAT folder to manage your own
 > code files (infinidat.py). If you want to add a new file in the
 > future or if you want to add a new INFINIDAT series driver. It will
 > easy to control it under the INFINIDAT folder. And your original
 > infinibox driver config don't have to be changed (share_driver =
 > manila.share.drivers.infinidat.InfiniboxShareDriver), If your
 > create your INFINIDAT folder later, the original driver config
 > about share_driver will be changed to manila.share.drivers.infinidat.infinidat.InfiniboxShareDriver

I consulted with some other developers in my company (including the Cinder driver developer) and we decided to keep it as one file under the drivers directory for this release, as no other files or modules are needed at the moment. If a change will be needed, we'll wait for a later release."}, {'account_id': 26968, 'date': '2017-11-30 08:16:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 26968, 'date': '2017-11-30 08:27:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 22770, 'date': '2017-11-30 08:37:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18:

> > Would you like to create a new INFINIDAT folder to manage your
 > own
 > > code files (infinidat.py). If you want to add a new file in the
 > > future or if you want to add a new INFINIDAT series driver. It
 > will
 > > easy to control it under the INFINIDAT folder. And your original
 > > infinibox driver config don't have to be changed (share_driver =
 > > manila.share.drivers.infinidat.InfiniboxShareDriver), If your
 > > create your INFINIDAT folder later, the original driver config
 > > about share_driver will be changed to manila.share.drivers.infinidat.infinidat.InfiniboxShareDriver
 > 
 > I consulted with some other developers in my company (including the
 > Cinder driver developer) and we decided to keep it as one file
 > under the drivers directory for this release, as no other files or
 > modules are needed at the moment. If a change will be needed, we'll
 > wait for a later release.

I don't see any compatibilty issue here.
If we later decide to move infinidat.py to infinidat/something.py, as long as we add 'from . import InfiniboxShareDriver' to infinidat/__init__.py that would be fine and won't require configuration changes"}, {'account_id': 26968, 'date': '2017-11-30 08:54:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 19.'}, {'account_id': 15100, 'date': '2017-11-30 08:59:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 19:

commit_message:
INFINIDAT add Manila driver

Adding basic driver version for the INFINIDAT Infinibox storage array.

Change-Id: I8299915a12b51c80a044f41ceb7a49da32745272
Implements: blueprint infinidat-manila-driver

commit_message:
VMware: Factor out relocate_vm()

VM relocation is not volume specific operation and should be moved to
vm_util.py

Change-Id: Ic129a8da2b3e6eed3635f3d8b07f32a60ec9d8e3
(cherry picked from commit 766d13218763f43ba91c2a15adff438a0dd84e37)

VMware: Factor out relocate_vm()

VM relocation is not volume specific operation and should be moved to
vm_util.py

commit_message:
Ceilosca pagination hanging problem

If enable_api_pagination is turned on
ceilometer statistics api call with group by
did not return any results. This review fixes
problem with indentation. Also fixing similar
problems with metric_list and measurement list
calls in monasca client.
Also added unit tests to test metrics list,
measurement list and statistics list when
pagination is enabled and also when disabled.

Change-Id: I2394da8c0c32d8516ac8136fcaaef87e546966b0

commit_message:
Fix scaling validation error

Sahara will validate resources when running scale cluster.
But we shouldn't check all resources in node groups while scaling,
because there are some configurations for MapReduce like
'mapreduce.reduce.java.opts' in 'node_configs' which are
added after validation.
This patch changes to validate resource in "node group
template" other than "node groups".

Closes-Bug: #1736671
Change-Id: I564b07cc4db275d4a369ce8cbff87cd6bda368fa

commit_message:
Set simple crypto plugin as global default for Barbican

This is needed for multiple config configuration.  Also,
renamed the parameters in the backend to be more consistent.

commit_message:
Queens: Assessment for neutron-vpnaas

This patch is following up from Pike discussion [1]. With the remaining
main gap (N4) has been addressed to be able to jump into the stadium.

[1] Ie06395533211847d741c9c9bbd45bc8edbab6e5c

commit_message:

commit_message:
collect logs: remove --ansible-debug

The level of output for BM jobs in rdophase2 is far
too verbose, and is complicating debugging CI.

This commit removes --ansible-debug from collect logs
invocation

Change-Id: Idf081fe44aa9fcdf040223f71fa31915144babf4

When cache settings are in place for ports and floating ips, we should

Change-Id: I304ff1c0e355bcfc00398316a296417c19e9b74f

commit_message:
Fix batching for floating ips and ports

When cache settings are in place for ports and floating ips, we should
be doing full list calls and filtering locally. This is done to prevent
things lke nodepool from crushing clouds under the weight of our immense
need for information.

Change-Id: I304ff1c0e355bcfc00398316a296417c19e9b74f

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 03:00:08.000000000', 'message': "ironic-agent: don't remove make

It turns out make has always been a tacit dependency of openssl as it
ships a Makefile for certificates [1].  This just recently changed to
be a hard dependency in F27, so this now fails as openssl is a
dependency of protected packages such as dnf.  Since it's always been
wrong to remove it, we take it out of the purge list.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=783446

Change-Id: I69efb3a56878ab97c4587bbbf5356bea752f2846
"}]
commit_message:
ironic-agent: don't remove make

It turns out make has always been a tacit dependency of openssl as it
ships a Makefile for certificates [1].  This just recently changed to
be a hard dependency in F27, so this now fails as openssl is a
dependency of protected packages such as dnf.  Since it's always been
wrong to remove it, we take it out of the purge list.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=783446

Change-Id: I69efb3a56878ab97c4587bbbf5356bea752f2846

commit_message:
Remove class StopWatch from timing

In new release timeutils.StopWatch can be used from oslo.uitls, so it was deprecated for removal in
timing.py

Closes-Bug: #1715043

messages: [{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-12-07 18:20:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-07 20:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-12-07 20:48:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 18:20:39.000000000', 'message': 'Increase timeout for openstack-tox-cover job

We are seeing some timeouts in particular for Neutron patches, the usual
runtime seems to be around 25 minutes. Increase the timeout from 30
minutes (default inherited from base job) to 40 minutes, which also
matches what we had with zuul v2.

Change-Id: Id1e1b5fd88649a3af460f4a8a3f4da51c350cbec
'}]
commit_message:
Increase timeout for openstack-tox-cover job

We are seeing some timeouts in particular for Neutron patches, the usual
runtime seems to be around 25 minutes. Increase the timeout from 30
minutes (default inherited from base job) to 40 minutes, which also
matches what we had with zuul v2.

Change-Id: Id1e1b5fd88649a3af460f4a8a3f4da51c350cbec

   ZooKeeper service;

'}]
commit_message:
Add ZooKeeper support in Vanilla cluster

This change adds the ability to deploy and manage ZooKeeper
service in vanilla. But User should be aware that you have
to deploy ZooKeeper cluster with the newest image.

Follow changes have been made to support ZooKeeper in Vanilla:
1. Open ports(2181, 2888, 3888) in SG(security group) by default;
2. Expose arguments(syncLimit, tickTime and initLimit) to manage
   ZooKeeper service;
3. Validate the node count of ZooKeeper machines to keep run an
   odd number of ZooKeeper services in cluster.

Change-Id: I846eba10eff668bb8583083b6eb884d04651418e
Partial-Implements: bp hbase-on-vanila

commit_message:
replace_six_iteritems

Replace six.iteritems() with .items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible, see the
link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: Ic90b6720f1cc1011d880319d2602b663e88fbc16

commit_message:
Use assertRegex instead of assertRegexpMatches

In Python3, assertRegexpMatches & assertNotRegexpMatches
are deprecated in favor of assertRegex and assertNotRegex.

Change-Id: I273a5efb7b901996a2e80db6edadead67d2d7016

commit_message:
Add new repo for congress tempest plugin

For Queens Goal "Split Tempest Plugins into Separate Repos/Projects",
this imports from a temporary github repo that preserves the history of the
plugin and additionally applies the openstack cookiecutter to it.

Needed-By: I8e39c145541619d45919adfdcf4984489777d3ba
Change-Id: I9b6b71ba33ad66248216e452fe1817ddc2aa1697

subject: Add documentation on adding smoke tests for plugins
messages:
[{'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2017-12-05 18:05:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2017-12-05 20:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

check experimental'}, {'account_id': 5196, 'date': '2017-12-07 18:58:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

The problem you're going to have with this is that in the gate. Grenade doesn't actually run tempest on the target side, it's devstack-gate that does that. So this will only have an effect in the gate on the old side.

Also, the use of the all-plugin target is potentially a problem. It uses global site-packages which has a high risk for causing weird cross interactions, especially with grenade jobs where there are multiple sets of requirements installed. It was added as a crutch for early plugin usage (and in-tree plugins) but with things as self contained plugins it is much easier and safer to just install the plugin in the tempest venv.

What I think the real fix this is to make sure your grenade jobs properly set TEMPEST_PLUGINS with your plugin(s) in the local.conf/localrc (or explicitly in the grenade or devstack plugins) to make sure that devstack installs your plugins into the tempest venv on both sides."}, {'account_id': 8099, 'date': '2017-12-07 19:29:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 18:05:31.000000000', 'message': 'All grenade to run plugin smoke tests

This ensures that base and target "smoke" tempest runs
include non tempest included tests.

Change-Id: I6118d98ff24027ade77f703713976f319d5e1c4f

commit_message:
Make designate.conf reproducible

The hostname of the build machine leaks in the designate.conf.
Therefore, this patch sets sample_default='<Hostname>' to make
the build reproducible.

If you don't know about reproducible build, please read here:
https://wiki.debian.org/ReproducibleBuilds/About

Change-Id: I972aed4cf47510eb669d1db61c8f569136f861b6
Closes-Bug: #1736801

two checks - cli and heat uses same code to check VM.

commit_message:
add info what happens and timeouts to dump_logs.sh

sometimes node is very slow to react to CLI and simple
call to get pods/logs can be more than 5 mins even it requires
1-2 seconds in normal system.
This patchset adds timeouts for such calls and printing info
what exatly logging now.

Change-Id: I3617adf9e946983908c92e2c4857e587f3a03033

commit_message:
CI: Test multi-rbd backend for cinder in scenario001

Set THT parameters that will create an extra Ceph pool to be used
as an additional backend for Cinder.

Implements: blueprint multiple-cinder-rbd-backend
Change-Id: I84c5cfe8d77b541f18909f4c2b246df69b73cf22

commit_message:
add keystone and neutron tempest plugins to default config

keystone and neutron are the only two tempest plugins
that are required to be installed by default.

Change-Id: I58a955943191045324956bd61da0652076984e8c

commit_message:
Remove log translations

Log messages are no longer being translated. This removes all use of the
_LE, _LI, and _LW translation markers to simplify logging and to avoid
confusion with new contributions.

See:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-i18n/2016-November/002574.html
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-March/113365.html

Change-Id: I471d79a86d88e98688246ffbdc29fb579f5fd52a

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 02:42:54.000000000', 'message': 'Base implementation of override_role for automatic role re-switch

This PS deprecated switch_role in rbac_utils and replaces it with
override_role. override_role realizes the same functionality as
switch_role, but uses @contextmanager so that role-switching can be
streamlined. This approach offers the following advantages:

  1) Role switching is performed in 1 class only. There is no
  need to call ``test_obj.switch_role(test_obj, toggle_rbac_role=False)``
  from ``rbac_rule_validation``. This de-coupling between both modules
  leads to cleaner, more readable code.
  2) Improves test code readability
  3) Improve policy granularity.

Rather than doing:

    # setup code here
    rand_name = data_utils.rand_name(...)
    # ...
    # more setup code here
    self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, toggle_rbac_role=True)
    # execute the test here

(Without newlines, this code is very hard to read.)

It is instead possible to now do:

    # setup code here
    rand_name = data_utils.rand_name(...)
    # ...
    # more setup code here
    with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self, toggle_rbac_role=True)
        # execute the test here
        # notice the indentation... visually it is easy to see
        # that this block here is where the role is switched
    # now we are back to admin credentials in case we still
    # need it in the test... this was not possible before w/o
    # calling ``switch_role`` yet again...
    waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, ...)

This commit:
  1) Adds the necessary logic to rbac_utils to allow for automatic
     role re-switch following test execution (i.e. override_role)
  2) Deprecates switch_role method in rbac_utils
  3) Refactors RBAC tests in test_volumes_extend_rbac to prove
     the concept introduced here
  #5) Cleans up code in a few places in the tests

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

commit_message:
Base implementation of override_role for automatic role re-switch

This PS deprecated switch_role in rbac_utils and replaces it with
override_role. override_role realizes the same functionality as
switch_role, but uses @contextmanager so that role-switching can be
streamlined. This approach offers the following advantages:

  1) Role switching is performed in 1 class only. There is no
  need to call ``test_obj.switch_role(test_obj, toggle_rbac_role=False)``
  from ``rbac_rule_validation``. This de-coupling between both modules
  leads to cleaner, more readable code.
  2) Improves test code readability.
  3) Improve role switch granularity, meaning the role remains switched
     within the narrowest scope possible.
  4) Simplifies interface, making it easier for test-writers to use
     the Patrole framework.

Rather than doing:

    # setup code here
    rand_name = data_utils.rand_name(...)
    # ...
    # more setup code here
    self.rbac_utils.switch_role(self, toggle_rbac_role=True)
    # execute the test here

(Without newlines, this code is very hard to read.)

It is instead possible to now do:

    # setup code here
    rand_name = data_utils.rand_name(...)
    # ...
    # more setup code here
    with self.rbac_utils.override_role(self):
        # execute the test here
        # notice the indentation... visually it is easy to see
        # that this block here is where the role is switched
    # now we are back to admin credentials in case we still
    # need it in the test... this was not possible before w/o
    # calling ``switch_role`` yet again...
    waiters.wait_for_volume_status(self.volumes_client, ...)

This commit:
  * Adds the necessary logic to rbac_utils to allow for automatic
    role re-switch following test execution (i.e. override_role)
  * Deprecates switch_role method in rbac_utils.
  * Refactors RBAC tests in test_volumes_extend_rbac to prove
    the concept introduced here.
  * Removes _validate_switch_role functionality since its purpose
    was to overcompensate for the old switch_role interface which
    allowed users to pass in a boolean flag; now this is no longer
    needed. Also removes associated unit tests.
  * Updates a docstring in rbac_utils module.

Partially Implements: blueprint rbac-utils-contextmanager

Change-Id: I670fba358bf321eae0d22d18cea6d2f530f00716

subject: Increase timeout for running coverage job on Neutron
messages: [{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:09:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-12-07 18:32:56.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nIncreasing timeout for the job globally instead, see https://review.openstack.org/526474'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 11:09:08.000000000', 'message': 'Increase timeout for running coverage job on Neutron

We are seeing repeated gate failures due to a timeout on the
openstack-tox-cover job for Neutron. The default timeout inherited from
the base job is 30 min, we are seeing successful runs taking about 25
minutes, which seems to be too tight a window. Increase the timeout to
60 minutes in order to be on the safe side.

Change-Id: I1e2036e2a0ae7a027c7227bfaa0009476e66e543
'}]
commit_message:
Increase timeout for running coverage job on Neutron

We are seeing repeated gate failures due to a timeout on the
openstack-tox-cover job for Neutron. The default timeout inherited from
the base job is 30 min, we are seeing successful runs taking about 25
minutes, which seems to be too tight a window. Increase the timeout to
60 minutes in order to be on the safe side.

Change-Id: I1e2036e2a0ae7a027c7227bfaa0009476e66e543

commit_message:
Enable Octavia LBaaS integration config in neutron

This patch includes the Octavia LBaaS puppet manifest in neutron when
Octavia is being deployed. This enables configuration of parameters
needed for Neutron to communicate with Octavia.

Change-Id: Ia3d4f9f6e93fa9affd8b732b90fccc027ee62fd1

commit_message:
Support populating certificate files

This patch extends octavia::certificates to support populating
certificate and key files using data passed in string form.

Change-Id: I8d46bad372b8c24b290500ee6040207cb808ba23

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 00:40:36.000000000', 'message': 'Adding query metric mappings, dimensions, futurist, paging

Adding capabilities to ceilosca to be able to query metrics that
are already being collected by monasca using mappings files
there are two types of mappings:
  1. Static Mapping: Currently it is used to map any static info
     about ceilometer meters like the type of meter or unit
  2. Extensive monasca mapping: currently it is used to map any
     monasca metric to a ceilometer meter example:
     meter_metric_map:
       - name: "disk.device.write.requests"
            monasca_metric_name: "vm.io.write_ops"
            resource_id: $.dimensions.resource_id
            project_id: $.dimensions.tenant_id
            user_id: $.dimensions.user_id
            region: "NA"
            type: "cumulative"
            unit: "request"
            source: "NA"
            resource_metadata: $.measurement[0][2]
     As you can see for this mapping fields on left side of ":"
     are used to map ceilometer fields and fields on right side
     for referring to monasca fields

Both of these mapping files are configurable and can be set in
ceilometer configuration file

cloud_name, cluster_name, and control plane fields
are now added as dimensions by monasca publisher when
publishing metrics to monasca api which is necessary
in multi-region deployment of notification agent.

monasca publisher does not use oslo.service LoopingCall
but instead uses futurist periodics library to enable
batching.

monasca client now pages through monasca api results
if enable_api_pagination is enabled in configuration.
This flag is disabled by default but should be enabled
if monasca api supports paging using "offsets"
parameter.

Tox testing is now targeting stable/newton branch of
ceilometer.

DocImpact

Ceilometer newton-eol

Change the test-requirements to use the newton-eol branch, as
the stable/newton branch no longer exists in Ceilometer.
Also limit the oslotest to < 2.0.0 to avoid a mockpatch issue
in ceilometer's db.py unit test.

Note this change should soon be replaced by a move to Pike, but
want to update this as a solid starting point before further work.

This matches change I 06b860bb72c3397e2763 11bd57291e9c3164a7e4

Change-Id: I83b96325cb79d82858cf529935e5d699a509f6c3

commit_message:
Adding query metric mappings, dimensions, futurist, paging

Adding capabilities to ceilosca to be able to query metrics that
are already being collected by monasca using mappings files
there are two types of mappings:
  1. Static Mapping: Currently it is used to map any static info
     about ceilometer meters like the type of meter or unit
  2. Extensive monasca mapping: currently it is used to map any
     monasca metric to a ceilometer meter example:
     meter_metric_map:
       - name: "disk.device.write.requests"
            monasca_metric_name: "vm.io.write_ops"
            resource_id: $.dimensions.resource_id
            project_id: $.dimensions.tenant_id
            user_id: $.dimensions.user_id
            region: "NA"
            type: "cumulative"
            unit: "request"
            source: "NA"
            resource_metadata: $.measurement[0][2]
     As you can see for this mapping fields on left side of ":"
     are used to map ceilometer fields and fields on right side
     for referring to monasca fields

Both of these mapping files are configurable and can be set in
ceilometer configuration file

cloud_name, cluster_name, and control plane fields
are now added as dimensions by monasca publisher when
publishing metrics to monasca api which is necessary
in multi-region deployment of notification agent.

monasca publisher does not use oslo.service LoopingCall
but instead uses futurist periodics library to enable
batching.

monasca client now pages through monasca api results
if enable_api_pagination is enabled in configuration.
This flag is disabled by default but should be enabled
if monasca api supports paging using "offsets"
parameter.

Tox testing is now targeting stable/newton branch of
ceilometer.

DocImpact

Ceilometer newton-eol

Change the test-requirements to use the newton-eol branch, as
the stable/newton branch no longer exists in Ceilometer.
Also limit the oslotest to < 2.0.0 to avoid a mockpatch issue
in ceilometer's db.py unit test.

Note this change should soon be replaced by a move to Pike, but
want to update this as a solid starting point before further work.

This matches change I 06b860bb72c3397e2763 11bd57291e9c3164a7e4

Change-Id: I83b96325cb79d82858cf529935e5d699a509f6c3

subject: Allow specifying targets in ini file
messages:
[{'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-11-06 08:57:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-11-06 10:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2017-11-07 00:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I'm not sure what this patch set solves. Right now you can just specify the [bandit] section in the tox.ini like how keystone does[0].

[0] https://github.com/openstack/keystone/blob/master/tox.ini#L39

Also tested this against keystone and it does not appear to work when setting "bandit --ini {toxinidir}/tox.ini -r -x tests

[main]	ERROR	No targets found in CLI or ini files, exiting.'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-11-07 08:03:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Gage,

what you are pointing is not a bandit section, it is a bandit tox environment ([testenv:bandit]) while bandit reads its configuration from "[bandit]" section of ini file.

What I am talking about is actual "[bandit]" section similar to what "[flake8]" supports.

So, taking keystone for example, one can change the tox.ini in the following way:

add "[bandit]" section:

  [bandit]
  targets = keystone
  exclude = tests

and modify "[testenv:bandit]" and "[testenv:pep8] sections to call bandit like
  
  bandit --ini {toxinidir}/tox.ini

Then it works.

In your case the error is telling what's there - no targets where found in either CLI nor in [bandit] section of ini file (as there is no such).'}, {'account_id': 9542, 'date': '2017-11-07 08:06:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

correction, bandit should still be called with -r 

  bandit -r --ini {toxinidir}/tox.ini

(may be add that to the options supported in ini file too?)'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2017-11-07 22:21:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Gage,
 > 
 > what you are pointing is not a bandit section, it is a bandit tox
 > environment ([testenv:bandit]) while bandit reads its configuration
 > from "[bandit]" section of ini file.
 > 
 > What I am talking about is actual "[bandit]" section similar to
 > what "[flake8]" supports.
 > 
 > So, taking keystone for example, one can change the tox.ini in the
 > following way:
 > 
 > add "[bandit]" section:
 > 
 > [bandit]
 > targets = keystone
 > exclude = tests
 > 
 > and modify "[testenv:bandit]" and "[testenv:pep8] sections to call
 > bandit like
 > 
 > bandit --ini {toxinidir}/tox.ini
 > 
 > Then it works.
 > 
 > In your case the error is telling what's there - no targets where
 > found in either CLI nor in [bandit] section of ini file (as there
 > is no such).

Ah ok, this makes more sense then. Thanks for clarifying, I'll retest this.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2017-11-16 21:25:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2017-12-06 22:41:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Ok, got around to testing this (sorry for the wait). This appears to work fine with setting a [bandit] section like described in a previous comment and still allows for running bandit via tox as before.'}, {'account_id': 17893, 'date': '2017-12-07 16:59:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
Allow specifying targets in ini file

this patch makes 'targets' args optional and allows to specify them
in the ini file.
This makes it possible to keep most of bandit configuration right in
the ini file.
OpenStack projects can now populate their tox.ini with [bandit] section
and do 'bandit --ini {toxinidir}/tox.ini -r' almost uniformly
accross all projects.

Change-Id: Ia0153e0aaa602171690ca8f66635fbea69b1cfab
Closes-Bug: #1730307

commit_message:
Accept only domain as well as OneView manager url

The prepare_manager_url only works when manager_url contains http or
https. One should be able to define the OneView manager_url using
either http, https or just the domain. This patch updates the
prepare_manager_url to accept those three cases.

Closes-Bug: 1730652
Change-Id: Ie09fc9e7fab1b58432f17402ebe3aa5aa4dc4261

commit_message:
Remove build-openstack-sphinx-docs from i18n

The i18n project can't use the new PTI because it does extra things in
its docs tox environment to get the job done. Remove
build-openstack-sphinx-docs from openstack/i18n in favor of the in-tree
job that was added.

Change-Id: I1c620f244df90c4ac0736b5e1422f0776589f417
Depends-On: I5237e750b4bc4899d71952a14c8d2ca92d9985a0

commit_message:
[APIv2]Nix custom OpenStack-Project-ID header

We don't need to be special/annoying. Other services whose APIs don't
need project ID in the URL do just fine trusting keystonemiddleware to
provide that info.

bp v2-api-experimental-impl

Change-Id: I8397ed7c134f0742de8c38466ed3f9035d8103d4

commit_message:
Add heat-tempest-plugin to grenade/sahara job

Otherwise the heat grenade plugin, which is enabled and used by Sahara,
fails, because the heat tests have been split but they are used by the
grenade plugin.

It is true that this could be migrated locally to sahara repositories,
but the effort is to try to push native jobs directly.

Change-Id: I15d1c25f5701e8fd3450f61cc661515639ba434a

subject: Fix auth version detection
messages:
[{'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-10-17 14:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2017-10-17 22:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This fix lets python monascaclient cli authenticate and the command works, but it still hits a v2 keystone. For example a monasca command using the --debug flag still has the line:
"Making authentication request to https://keystone:35357/v2.0/tokens"

I have found that adding the OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION variable to the env parser does fix the problem, but only if you feed it gibberish instead of an expected value of '2' or '3'. What are your thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-10-23 12:00:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Andrea, which set of variables do you use? I have tested the following [1] with both public and admin endpoint and it seems to work correctly.

[1] http://paste.openstack.org/show/624365/'}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2017-11-03 20:19:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

The PR https://github.com/monasca/monasca-docker/pull/245#discussion_r148533484 is showing this behavior. The log is at https://storage.googleapis.com/monasca-ci-logs/monasca-docker/2017-11-03_19-38-31_monasca_logs/run/docker_log_monascadocker_alarms_1.log.gz'}, {'account_id': 27143, 'date': '2017-12-05 12:39:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-12-05 13:09:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Andrea, I guess you need something like:

 export OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION=${OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION:-"3"}

around line https://github.com/monasca/monasca-docker/blob/master/monasca-alarms/start.sh#L13
Does it block this review?'}, {'account_id': 22157, 'date': '2017-12-05 16:31:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

No, I'm not blocked by this bug, but thank you for your concern. Ill try your suggestion."}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2017-12-06 09:37:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21922, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

build-openstack-sphinx-docs is failing'}, {'account_id': 16222, 'date': '2017-12-07 15:54:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-17 14:36:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix auth version detection

If OS_CLOUD is not set the defalt value is parsed which is empty string. This
is wrong, as it deactivates all other environment variables for cloud
configuration.

Change-Id: I48452bb5300fcc46047f8e94501bba1c42629ea1
Story: 2001158
Task: 4890
(cherry picked from commit fecf0e3d664e2681a0f5ba0a94b2359935d3a353)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix auth version detection

If OS_CLOUD is not set the defalt value is parsed which is empty string. This
is wrong, as it deactivates all other environment variables for cloud
configuration.

Change-Id: I48452bb5300fcc46047f8e94501bba1c42629ea1
Story: 2001158
Task: 4890
(cherry picked from commit fecf0e3d664e2681a0f5ba0a94b2359935d3a353)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 11:02:43.000000000', 'message': 'Publish deploy guide updates for all branches

The deploy guide for projects may change after the creation
of the stable branch, and those changes are not currently
publishing - instead leaving the deploy guide in the state
it was last published before the stable branch existed.

This changes the job to ensure that updates for all branches
are published, not just the master branch.

Change-Id: Id515a869ca43352a72953e7a2f50db364773b4ae
'}]
commit_message:
Publish deploy guide updates for all branches

The deploy guide for projects may change after the creation
of the stable branch, and those changes are not currently
publishing - instead leaving the deploy guide in the state
it was last published before the stable branch existed.

This changes the job to ensure that updates for all branches
are published, not just the master branch.

Change-Id: Id515a869ca43352a72953e7a2f50db364773b4ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 19:01:15.000000000', 'message': "Don't attempt to run py27 on nova-specs

With the move to zuulv3, the py27 job is never run on
nova-specs changes because the openstack-tox-py27 job
definition in openstack-zuul-jobs ignores changes to
docs and rst files, which is basically all that is in
the nova-specs repo. So we've dropped the py27 target
in nova-specs and just run the same tests under pep8.

Change-Id: I8300f3c9270095f9fd0ab0dbc8cd8155252d08ff
Depends-On: Ic87e79db6a8881398d670148b609e0b81658dfd1
"}]
commit_message:
Don't attempt to run py27 on nova-specs

With the move to zuulv3, the py27 job is never run on
nova-specs changes because the openstack-tox-py27 job
definition in openstack-zuul-jobs ignores changes to
docs and rst files, which is basically all that is in
the nova-specs repo. So we've dropped the py27 target
in nova-specs and just run the same tests under pep8.

Change-Id: I8300f3c9270095f9fd0ab0dbc8cd8155252d08ff
Depends-On: Ic87e79db6a8881398d670148b609e0b81658dfd1

commit_message:
Add an openstack/self-healing-sig repository

The Self-healing SIG is interested in using Storyboard for task
tracking purposes. At the moment our means of avoiding name
collisions is to make sure each project in SB has a matching
repository in Gerrit, so create the necessary repo as a placeholder
(it may be used for revision control of documents or other artifacts
pertaining to the SIG in the future, but they have no actual plans
for it at this time).

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Self-healing_SIG
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-sigs/2017-December/000198.html

Change-Id: If4fed236b6a679a635e17984f1cd07e98e21758c
Needed-By: Ie2bba5e8914eb5422974b968183498471fae37cb

commit_message:
Make stable jobs voting on Tempest

Stable jobs have always been voting on Tempest to prevent Tempest
changes from breaking stable branches. We never ran stable jobs on gate
though and I think that should stay the same. Given the low volume of
changes on stable, it's highgly unlikely that a change that passes in
check behaves differently on gate.

The voting part was lost in the zuulv3 migration, so restoring it.

Change-Id: Ifa69d4ea405f6c243eddf303cff7dcedec4bad4d

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-01 11:10:20.000000000', 'message': "Move governance tag validation to experimental

The governance repository 'validate' test job currently only
tests that the diversity tags match the current demographics
in the project teams.

It is useful to validate diversity tag changes, but not so
much as a test job run on every change. Since diversity tags
are not continuously updated, it is expected that after a few
weeks the job will systematically fail.

It is still useful information in some cases, for example when
a new team is proposed and you're not sure which diversity tag
they should get, or when diversity tags are updated.

Move the validate test job to the experimental pipeline so that
the information can be retrieved in those specific cases by
running 'check experimental' as needed.

Change-Id: I420bd7bd568d102248dde43137a0a9273dfc6c41
"}]
commit_message:
Move governance tag validation to experimental

The governance repository 'validate' test job currently only
tests that the diversity tags match the current demographics
in the project teams.

It is useful to validate diversity tag changes, but not so
much as a test job run on every change. Since diversity tags
are not continuously updated, it is expected that after a few
weeks the job will systematically fail.

It is still useful information in some cases, for example when
a new team is proposed and you're not sure which diversity tag
they should get, or when diversity tags are updated.

Move the validate test job to the experimental pipeline so that
the information can be retrieved in those specific cases by
running 'check experimental' as needed.

Change-Id: I420bd7bd568d102248dde43137a0a9273dfc6c41

commit_message:
Creating a function that calls /usr/bin/timeout

Due the fact that in the future, we will have several ansible-playbooks
calls, we need to create a function that will calculate the remaining time
for each call. This function gets the START_JOB_TIME and
calculate how much time still has, and execute the command with
/usr/bin/timeout

Change-Id: Ib4766ea144baaaf1b47899c4923adf40a3be4582

[{'created': '2017-12-05 13:24:19.000000000', 'message': 'Shutdown placement at the end of the base run

Placement API was not being shutdown at the end of the OLD target,
thus when it was being started at the beginning of the NEW target it
was not actually getting new code.

This  adjusts the nova shutdown.sh to make sure that placement-api
is included in the services that are stopped. If/when placement
migrates to its own thing it ought to move.

Change-Id: I7f2158aeaef82a47e11c6e29675e542023fff4be
Closes-Bug: #1736385
'}, {'created': '2017-12-05 18:41:33.000000000', 'message': 'Shutdown placement at the end of the base run

Placement API was not being shutdown at the end of the OLD target,
thus when it was being started at the beginning of the NEW target it
was not actually getting new code. A call to stop_placement is added.

In addition, make sure placement is installed in upgrade.sh so that
any new stuff is in place.

The depends-on is to a devstack change which makes sure that
lib/placement does not call remove_uwsgi_config when stop_placement is
called. Without this, there's no config file for the
devstack@placement-api systemd unit to run, and there is an immediate

Change-Id: I7f2158aeaef82a47e11c6e29675e542023fff4be
Depends-On: Iee763adf7895145d97b184924896db3f1f48a015
Closes-Bug: #1736385

commit_message:
Shutdown placement at the end of the base run

Placement API was not being shutdown at the end of the OLD target,
thus when it was being started at the beginning of the NEW target it
was not actually getting new code. A call to stop_placement is added.

In addition, make sure placement is installed in upgrade.sh so that
any new stuff is in place.

The depends-on is to a devstack change which makes sure that
lib/placement does not call remove_uwsgi_config when stop_placement is
called. Without this, there's no config file for the
devstack@placement-api systemd unit to run, and there is an immediate
exit.

Change-Id: I7f2158aeaef82a47e11c6e29675e542023fff4be
Depends-On: Iee763adf7895145d97b184924896db3f1f48a015
Closes-Bug: #1736385

commit_message:
Add IPv6 support to create_websocket()

The current implementation is hardcoded to use AF_INET, which means
IPv4. We need to be able to support IPv6 connections, too, so we use the
socket.getaddrinfo() function as described in [1] in order to provide a
more generic solution.

[1] https://docs.python.org/2/library/socket.html

Change-Id: I2ccbe3b25e79031a3c961871034c0c1b94d7ee80
Closes-Bug: 1719575
Related-Bug: 1656329

commit_message:
Disable unstable tempest test_create_action_execution_sync test

This disables test_create_action_execution_sync.
Doing so allows us to mvoe towards a voting tempest job. We need to come
back and fix or replace this test later.

Related-Bug: #1736685
Change-Id: Icfa134d391476cad6ef925c84e93754d8a625ef2

commit_message:
Run monascaclient docs jobs on master only

Generating docs has been added in Queens release. This change disables
running publish-openstack-sphinx-docs template jobs for branches
stable/ocata and stable/pike.

Change-Id: I7f6000ca3f1bb8d699c7accc7a75cdb3b369adc5

commit_message:
Remove pip_install dependency

With addition of pip_install on every node, we don't
need to have pip_install as a meta dependency.

messages:
[{'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2017-12-04 13:45:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-04 14:07:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

This repo is used by all of OpenStack projects and they do branch.

If we use the PDFs for other documents - see https://review.openstack.org/509297 - , the other repos will have versions as well.

So, this is the wrong approach.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:30:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Indeed. It would be better to check if the variable was unset and only ignore it then if so'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2017-12-05 06:06:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2017-12-05 06:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2017-12-05 07:36:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2017-12-05 09:35:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-12-05 11:20:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review+1

Let's see whether this works..."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-06 12:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-06 12:22:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-06 12:42:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:29:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 12:

My TeX skills are rusty ;( Let's go back to your version..."}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:30:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2017-12-06 15:26:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

Not using additional packages as much as possible would be best but it seems that using ifx directive does not work well [1]. According to [2], ifthen is not obsolete and is in latex-base [3] mentioned in bindep.txt.

Another approach might be to modify [4] to define something more but this might not be a good approach since it requires to edit conf.py file.


[1] https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/192374/whats-the-difference-in-behavior-between-ifx-and-ifthenelse
[2] https://tex.stackexchange.com/questions/13866/why-is-the-ifthen-package-obsolete
[3] http://ctan.org/pkg/ifthen
[4] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/openstackdocstheme/tree/openstackdocstheme/__init__.py'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-06 15:38:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Code-Review-1

looking at patch set 5, it seems this does not work yet correctly.

Could you double check...

I'm fine now with using ifthen."}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2017-12-06 15:43:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13:

> Could you double check...

Aha that is because patch 5 includes the modification on conf.py - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/525187/5..13'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2017-12-06 15:50:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 14.'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2017-12-06 15:51:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 14:

Back to PS 8, let's check if it works. :)"}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:27:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 14: Code-Review-1

This is failing for me locally with the following message

    ! Argument of \@firstoftwo has an extra }.
    <inserted text> 
                    \par 
    l.67 \chapter
                 {Using the theme}

It seems the gate is seeing the same issue.

If you have a Fedora installation, I have outlined the steps necessary to get this to build locally here:

  https://that.guru/blog/create-pdfs-for-openstack/'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2017-12-07 04:16:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2017-12-07 05:11:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Published edit on patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 19779, 'date': '2017-12-07 05:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 16: Code-Review+2

Thanks all of you involved.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2017-12-07 06:38:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 17.'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2017-12-07 06:43:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 17:

I changed the variable names and added more comments.

Note that the first implementation of release part in PDF was inspired by [5] and version part support in latex has not implemented yet [6].

commit_message:
Tag monasca-common and monasca-agent

Bump the version for monasca common and monasca-agent
because we need changes in monasca-common and monasca-agent
is using monasca-common for validation.

Change-Id: Ifc1524f2a80490e45e86a887c46f4bdb1b021167

commit_message:
Add support for OVN Metadata Agent

This patch adds support for configuring networking-ovn-metadata-agent.

Depends-On: I38f775479d178f5b252619635b67f876bc8c5ed5

Change-Id: Ifdd42437333730a3b3e6f36cbab6df0a2971a5a1
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Make CephPools override properties of other pools

Previously it was possible to use CephPools tol override properties
of any pool, not only the additional ones defined via CephPools
parameter.

This change restores the functionality which was broken with the
migration of the templates to ceph-ansible.

Change-Id: Id184d5e7fe60c789944159ea32dc1267aca9decb
Closes-Bug: #1734093

This change or one of its cross-repo dependencies was unable to be automatically merged with the current state of its repository. Please rebase the change and upload a new patchset.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-08-20 00:59:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

Okay, lets take this to the openstack-dev ML and layout a list of requirements for using community infrastructure. This won't take years, but will take some time. Saying it is faster or easier to provision the servers manually isn't good argument. Especially since we have existing infrastructure in place.

Do you mind starting the thread on the ML listing the requirements?"}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-08-20 08:53:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@Paul, I don't understand you - which requirements do you mean? 

I didn't say it's easier and faster to provision manually. We don't provision it manually. Right now it's only possible a way to do it. 

"Some time" is not some time, it's a enormous long time which makes completely useless graphite.o.o. If I need to measure a particular deployment step to investigate a bug for a few days, I need to wait months until it will be merged and then months until it will be reverted. That's what happens all the time, if happens at all.

Please don't force on us to use noncomplying and not-so-working solution, because then I'll come up with something else, because we need it to work finally. Firstly you need to improve merging patches policy in o-infra and allow people to merge and manage their own stuff.'}, {'account_id': 4162, 'date': '2017-08-21 01:13:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

We seem to be going in circles, however the issue for me is tripleo should not be standing up private infrastructure, for things the project uses.  Yes, this has been a long standing issue with the project, but we have been making progress over the past year.

Specifically, here is the scope of the infrastructure project:

The project infrastructure encompasses all of the systems that are used in the day to day operation of the OpenStack project as a whole. This includes development, testing, and collaboration tools. All of the software that we run is open source, and its configuration is public. The project still uses a number of systems that do not yet fall under this umbrella (notably, the main website), but were working to incorporate them so that people may just as easily contribute to those areas. All new services used by the project should begin as part of the infrastructure project to ensure easy collaboration from the start.

Please see: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/system-config/project.html

I am sorry if you see this as forcing you to use a 'noncomplying and not-so-working solution', I am pointing out we already have http://graphite.openstack.org today and why can that not be used in place of your private instance?

As for requirements, I am still trying to understand how you use the graphite server, since it has been around for some time.

I'll move this to the ML this week so we can get more eyes on the discussion and see how we can accomplish the tasks you are looking to do."}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2017-09-25 01:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-09-25 01:10:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Verified-1

commit_message:
Send graphite stats from ARA

Send ARA playbook statistics to Graphite server in rh1
cloud for rh1 and rdo cloud jobs only.
It includes overcloud deploy time, undercloud install time,
images building time, etc.

Change-Id: Iad21084dff7541e50b9b193e3a5186584d0ab55a
Depends-On: I7167b62dada67403faf1f5171d6cddef419e8da2

subject: DNM: Moving OVS configuration and start to Step 4
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 17:19:08.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Moving OVS configuration and start to Step 4

DO NOT MERGE: Testing the impact of moving the neutron OVS agent
configuration and startup to step 4. This will allow operations
in step 5 workflow tasks to create and manipulate neutron ports.

Change-Id: I7d16d9d3113ebffb25dcf2a95fa4403ea735cd5d
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Moving OVS configuration and start to Step 4

DO NOT MERGE: Testing the impact of moving the neutron OVS agent
configuration and startup to step 4. This will allow operations
in step 5 workflow tasks to create and manipulate neutron ports.

Change-Id: I7d16d9d3113ebffb25dcf2a95fa4403ea735cd5d

commit_message:
Validate library files for documentation string

The ansible library files should all have a DOCUMENTATION and EXAMPLES variables.
This commit makes the CI fail in case the variables are missing from the
files in 'validations/library' subdirectory.

Change-Id: Ibd38d893ed1ff0e1032c2f97c0eb1e71d3897ea4
(cherry picked from commit 3b9d39b2e4a5f3e1e5c10c2dc000da8a5989ed9b)

messages: [{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-11-24 13:57:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-29 23:53:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4328, 'date': '2017-12-07 11:36:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nWe also set this in the stackrc, do we need an instack-undercloud patch to clean that up also?'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-24 13:57:17.000000000', 'message': 'Stop setting IRONIC_API_VERSION and OS_BAREMETAL_API_VERSION in overcloudrc

Starting with python-ironicclient 2.0.0, this is no longer needed to access
the latest features, as the default API version is now the latest version
supported by both the client and the server.

Change-Id: Icfc631484a500fd7730d807bcc0e87da62895187
Closes-Bug: #1671145
'}]
commit_message:
Stop setting IRONIC_API_VERSION and OS_BAREMETAL_API_VERSION in overcloudrc

Starting with python-ironicclient 2.0.0, this is no longer needed to access
the latest features, as the default API version is now the latest version
supported by both the client and the server.

Change-Id: Icfc631484a500fd7730d807bcc0e87da62895187
Closes-Bug: #1671145

commit_message:
Fix migrate action with migration_type 'cold'

Migration action with migration_type 'cold' does not work.
This patch fixes nova_helper to follow Pike release python-novaclient.

Change-Id: I0637cefad68cd4b7077a5d3e6b5db5562e7f2917
Closes-Bug: #1736624

commit_message:
Increase oslo.policy minimum version

Nova would like to use functionality to deprecate policies
 - Ie05f4e84519f8a00ffb66ea5ee920d5c7722a66b

For that we need to increase the minimum version of oslo.policy,

Ref- I6348299970a1be502909f698a432b3bcaf6b9c8b

Change-Id: I6aed4909b0e7efe9c95d1f7398db613eca05e5ce

commit_message:
Do not create roles unless keystone was deployed

In some setups (eg. kubespray deployments) we do not deploy keystone
and the post-deploy script would fail when trying to create the
heat_stack_owner role.

Change-Id: Iec503c750fd29fe5c27e27e84c58b65f0da6e75b

commit_message:
Concurrent upload container images

This change uses multiprocessing to speed the pull/push of the
container images for the command "overcloud container image upload"

Closes-Bug: #1733740

Change-Id: I70cb86de4e0be5a8994ca1936e3b26749b6dde59

As log says, 'oslo_messaging.transport.get_transport()' is deprecated.
The reference link of oslo_messaging is at [1].

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-24 05:24:46.000000000', 'message': "Import api returns 500 if disk and container formats are not set

If you run image-import api on any image which is in in queued
state and container-format and disk-format are not set will return
500 error as it raises 'ValueError: Properties disk_format,
container_format must be set prior to saving data'.

Caught ValueError and raised HTTPBadReuqest to return HTTP 400
error to the user.

Change-Id: Ide4ca9492b9296c74f8302d2d12e385bb5ad663b
Closes-Bug: #1733810

commit_message:
Fix 500 on ValueError during image-import

ValueError is being raised during image-import,
and it's not being caught, leading to a 500. So this
change catches the ValueError and raises a HTTPBadRequest.

Change-Id: Ide4ca9492b9296c74f8302d2d12e385bb5ad663b
Closes-Bug: #1733810

commit_message:
Add description for different interfaces

when run kolla-ansible command, the priority of globals.yml is
higher than multinode, we should comment out the vars in globals.yml
and make mutinode's vars effect.

factory, the mechanism in nova.api.openstack.placement.wsgi for
overriding the location of the configuration file is ignored

Instead pass the already existing conf with 'olso_config_config'
parameter.

The unit test in test_deploy.py shows that the configuration
settings get passed to the middleware and used by testing the
value of the 'WWW-Authenticate' header (which comes from a few
different configuration settings, of which is 'auth_uri') in
a response generated by the placement WSGI application.

Change-Id: I61d20c5d19797f7e66648c7864a632f3328be8ce
Closes-Bug: #1734491
"}]
commit_message:
[placement] re-use existing conf with auth token middleware

If 'oslo_config_project' is passed to the auth_token filter
factory, the mechanism in nova.api.openstack.placement.wsgi for
overriding the location of the configuration file is ignored
meaning that expected custom configuration is also ignored.

Instead pass the already existing conf with 'olso_config_config'
parameter.

The unit test in test_deploy.py shows that the configuration
settings get passed to the middleware and used by testing the
value of the 'WWW-Authenticate' header (which comes from a few
different configuration settings, of which is 'auth_uri') in
a response generated by the placement WSGI application.
The same test against the previous deploy.py code fails.

Change-Id: I61d20c5d19797f7e66648c7864a632f3328be8ce
Closes-Bug: #1734491

Related-Bug: #1733874
'}]
commit_message:
Set nova dhcp_domain to empty string

With change I4db66155b2c4ba8e0639ec00f938a8bc2ac85762 we removed this
setting entirely but in such a scenario nova is appending .novalocal
and not leaving it empty.

This change explicitly sets it value to empty string, as we do already
for the overcloud [1].

1. https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/blob/stable/pike/puppet/services/nova-base.yaml#L221

Change-Id: Iffe0f3d7b85586534d558bc552ac21998391efac
Related-Bug: #1733874

commit_message:
Upgrade non-controller nodes via the cli and mistral

Follow up review from the work to implement the upgrade
workflow in mistral.
This review aims to run the non controller upgrade with
ansible via mistral and the cli

commit_message:
Move legacy jobs to project

This patch implements first step in zuulv3 migration guide [1]:

Move jobs to storlets repo

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/zuulv3.html#legacy-job-migration-details

Change-Id: I4f58dc284b47e4892b812a3f3ff0b8427738131b

commit_message:
Fix swift endpoint

The swift actions are not working. Need to pass the preauthurl to the
client with the actual swift endpoint.

Change-Id: I991f91c4dace8d82a7b3204b039c080b8399f63b

commit_message:
Disable unstable tempest multi_vim_authentication test

This disables test_multi_vim_support_target_headers_and_service_catalog.
Doing so allows us to mvoe towards a voting tempest job. We need to come
back and fix or replace this test later.

Related-Bug: #1736685
Change-Id: Ie6a9e67837fb8c6386f915209ecf11974ab052c6

Code looks fine for me but I still have some questions to author.
1. What about validation of rules validation? What if user will attach QoS policy with e.g. DSCP marking rule or minimum bandwidth limit rule to FIP? Will it be applied and silently ignored?
2. What with inheritance of QoS policy from network to FIP? Will it work in same way as for "regular" ports?
Also I think that some docs update is necessary also in this patch.
3. I'm not an FIP expert so I might be wrong but AFAIK floating ip have something like "dummy" port created always. Why we can't associate QoS policy directly with this port and need to create another binding in db for it?'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2017-11-04 14:03:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

> Code looks fine for me but I still have some questions to author.
 > 1. What about validation of rules validation? What if user will
 > attach QoS policy with e.g. DSCP marking rule or minimum bandwidth
 > limit rule to FIP? Will it be applied and silently ignored?


Yes, L3 agent will only consider each(both) max ingress and egress bandwidth of the qos rules of the qos policy. It worth to note that, if there are multiple ingress/egress bandwidth rule, the first or the max will be set to floating IP tc only.


DSCP marking can be implemented in a future propose.


 > 2. What with inheritance of QoS policy from network to FIP? Will it
 > work in same way as for "regular" ports?


I think the floating IP's qos policy will reset the network policy, same as network to port.


 > Also I think that some docs update is necessary also in this patch.


Done


 > 3. I'm not an FIP expert so I might be wrong but AFAIK floating ip
 > have something like "dummy" port created always. Why we can't
 > associate QoS policy directly with this port and need to create
 > another binding in db for it?


That port is not visible to a none-admin user. And that port was not used in agent side. Actually I don't want L3 stuffs involved to L2 too much. An explicit L3 bonding looks better.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-11-04 20:17:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review+1

> > Code looks fine for me but I still have some questions to author.
 > > 1. What about validation of rules validation? What if user will
 > > attach QoS policy with e.g. DSCP marking rule or minimum
 > bandwidth
 > > limit rule to FIP? Will it be applied and silently ignored?
 > 
 > 
 > Yes, L3 agent will only consider each(both) max ingress and egress
 > bandwidth of the qos rules of the qos policy. It worth to note
 > that, if there are multiple ingress/egress bandwidth rule, the
 > first or the max will be set to floating IP tc only.

That sounds fine for me as a first step. But we should think about implementation of validation mechanism, similar to what we have currently when QoS policy is assigned for port/network.

 > 
 > 
 > DSCP marking can be implemented in a future propose.
 > 
 > 
 > > 2. What with inheritance of QoS policy from network to FIP? Will
 > it
 > > work in same way as for "regular" ports?
 > 
 > 
 > I think the floating IP's qos policy will reset the network policy,
 > same as network to port.

Yes, but what if floating IP will not have assigned QoS policy but network will have? In such case port inherits QoS policy from network to which it belongs. Will floating IP also inherit QoS policy from network?

 > 
 > 
 > > Also I think that some docs update is necessary also in this
 > patch.
 > 
 > 
 > Done
 > 
 > 
 > > 3. I'm not an FIP expert so I might be wrong but AFAIK floating
 > ip
 > > have something like "dummy" port created always. Why we can't
 > > associate QoS policy directly with this port and need to create
 > > another binding in db for it?
 > 
 > 
 > That port is not visible to a none-admin user. And that port was
 > not used in agent side. Actually I don't want L3 stuffs involved to
 > L2 too much. An explicit L3 bonding looks better.

Ok, thx for explanations :)'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2017-11-06 02:47:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

@Slawek, hello, I think the doc updating can be done in a new patch. The openstack client patch is uploaded here [1]. After this [2] and [1] all get merged, we can update the doc [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/517845/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/424466/
[3] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/doc/source/admin/config-qos.rst'}, {'account_id': 9531, 'date': '2017-11-06 02:50:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

> > > 2. What with inheritance of QoS policy from network to FIP?
 > Will
 > > it
 > > > work in same way as for "regular" ports?
 > >
 > >
 > > I think the floating IP's qos policy will reset the network
 > policy,
 > > same as network to port.
 > 
 > Yes, but what if floating IP will not have assigned QoS policy but
 > network will have? In such case port inherits QoS policy from
 > network to which it belongs. Will floating IP also inherit QoS
 > policy from network?
 > 

Currently the floating IP has no policy at all, so I think we can keep such behavior. So we do not  inherits QoS policy from network for floating IPs.'}, {'account_id': 15309, 'date': '2017-11-06 06:52:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review+1

I see, sorry for the previous review.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2017-11-06 08:14:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22:

> > > > 2. What with inheritance of QoS policy from network to FIP?
 > > Will
 > > > it
 > > > > work in same way as for "regular" ports?
 > > >
 > > >
 > > > I think the floating IP's qos policy will reset the network
 > > policy,
 > > > same as network to port.
 > >
 > > Yes, but what if floating IP will not have assigned QoS policy
 > but
 > > network will have? In such case port inherits QoS policy from
 > > network to which it belongs. Will floating IP also inherit QoS
 > > policy from network?
 > >
 > 
 > Currently the floating IP has no policy at all, so I think we can
 > keep such behavior. So we do not  inherits QoS policy from network
 > for floating IPs.

I'm not sure about that. IMO we should be as much consistent with current behavior as possible which means we should inherit QoS policy from Network to floating IPs also.
I see the case when e.g. Public Cloud operator want's to "force" some bandwidth limit for all new Floating IPs and it can be achieved by this inherit from network policy.
I think that some core reviewers should say what they think about that. @Miguell, @Ihar what You think about inherit/not inherit QoS policy from network to floating IPs?'}, {'account_id': 18051, 'date': '2017-11-07 17:06:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 22: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-01-24 07:04:19.000000000', 'message': '[L3][QoS] Flating IP rate limit

Add rate_limit to floating IP, then the user could set/update
the bandwidth of a floating IP more convenient.
The valid value of rate_limit is [0, 10000], and the unit
is Mbps, and the unit for tc policy filter burst/rate is Mb/Mbit,
then minimum bandwidth will be 1Mbps.
The cloud user could set the rate_limit in floatingip_create
or update it after creation.

The 0 value of the rate_limit means unlimited bandwidth.
But only the admin user could set the floating IP rate_limit
value to 0.

APIImpact
DocImpact
Related-Bug: #1596611
Change-Id: I4efe9e49d268dffeb3df4de4ea1780152218633b

'}, {'created': '2017-02-06 06:03:51.000000000', 'message': '[L3][QoS] Floating IP rate limit

Add rate_limit to floating IP, then the user could set/update
the bandwidth of a floating IP more convenient.
The valid value of rate_limit is [0, 10000], and the unit
is Mbps, and the unit for tc policy filter burst/rate is Mb/Mbit,
then minimum bandwidth will be 1Mbps.
The cloud user could set the rate_limit in floatingip_create
or update it after creation.

The 0 value of the rate_limit means unlimited bandwidth.
But only the admin user could set the floating IP rate_limit
value to 0.

APIImpact: a new parameter rate_limit was added to floating IP
related API.

DocImpact: implemented floating IP QoS, now both admin and cloud
user can simply set a IP bandwidth.

Related-Bug: #1596611
Change-Id: I4efe9e49d268dffeb3df4de4ea1780152218633b

commit_message:
[L3][QoS] Neutron server side Floating IP QoS

Add qos_policy_id to floating IP, then the user could set/update
the binding QoS policy of a floating IP.

APIImpact: a new parameter qos_policy_id was added to floating IP
related API.

Partial-Bug: #1596611
Partially-Implements blueprint: floating-ip-rate-limit
Change-Id: I4efe9e49d268dffeb3df4de4ea1780152218633b
