messages:
[{'account_id': 23364, 'date': '2017-12-01 10:51:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2017-12-01 10:52:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 23364, 'date': '2017-12-01 10:53:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2017-12-01 20:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(3 comments)

Thanks for the contribution! Normally I would keep this short but since you are a new contributor... 
There are couple errors reported by the Zuul check. You can click the links next to the FAILURE and see the output, here is the output for the result of legacy-tempest-dsvm-py35:
http://logs.openstack.org/59/524559/2/check/legacy-tempest-dsvm-py35/112c5c0/job-output.txt.gz

I provided some comments in line to help fix some of these  (Lines 51 and 59) and one more improvement on the other line.

Lastly, be sure to run your tests and style checking and fixing any errors before submitting code.
style checking can be ran by tox: tox -e pep8
tests can be ran according to the projects README, or for your case, from the projects home directory, run the following: tempest run --regex tempest.api.identity.admin.v3.test_list_users'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2017-12-04 10:30:46.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from bug_tempest to addClassResourceCleanup'}, {'account_id': 23364, 'date': '2017-12-06 07:30:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23364, 'date': '2017-12-06 07:33:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks Trevor for your comments. i have incorporated your inputs in next patch.'}, {'account_id': 20378, 'date': '2017-12-06 14:17:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

looks good, thanks!'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2017-12-07 01:24:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

LGTM thanks.'}, {'account_id': 20190, 'date': '2017-12-07 02:02:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

[{'created': '2017-12-06 08:16:32.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a missing preposition in plugin doc

In "While there are no hard and fast rules for the structure a plugin"
a preposition is missing between "structure" and "a plugin", this is
to fix it.

Change-Id: Ib22f614dece35d2ed79fa660027e50840e77d7bb

commit_message:
Fix a missing preposition in plugin doc

In "While there are no hard and fast rules for the structure a plugin"
a preposition is missing between "structure" and "a plugin", this is
to fix it.

Change-Id: Ib22f614dece35d2ed79fa660027e50840e77d7bb

Blair', 'email': 'jim@acmegating.com', 'username': 'corvus'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1653, 'name': 'garyk', 'email': 'gkotton@vmware.com', 'username': 'garyk'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 14595, 'name': 'z Systems KVM', 'email': 'zkvm-ci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'ibm-zkvm-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-11-21 17:46:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2017-11-21 18:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-11-21 21:02:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-11-21 21:38:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

If $name needs to appear in the plugin anywhere to declare dependencies, we need to define those and not rely on convention to just use the right names in enable_plugin() calls.  enable_plugin() _could_ validate that the name passed by the user matches the name declared by the plugin it just loaded as a bit of warning if not enforcement'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-11-22 00:23:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Agreed -- also, enable_plugin could use the dependency info to verify that plugins have been enabled in the correct order.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-11-22 00:31:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-11-22 00:33:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-11-22 17:37:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-11-22 22:49:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 970, 'date': '2017-12-05 16:12:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

This looks good, thanks'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-12-06 09:07:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1, 'date': '2017-12-06 22:02:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 17:46:18.000000000', 'message': 'Allow plugins to express dependency info

Add a no-op function, "plugin_requires" to allow plugins to indicate
their dependencies on each other.  This will be used by the Devstack
Ansible module when writing local.conf files.

Change-Id: Ibd8c7222ed7dfb08d7ea821d871fc6f3b88de24b
'}, {'created': '2017-11-22 00:31:42.000000000', 'message': 'Allow plugins to express dependency info

Add a no-op function, "plugin_requires" to allow plugins to indicate
their dependencies on each other.  This will be used by the Devstack
Ansible module when writing local.conf files.

Also add define_plugin to allow plugins to indicate their canonical
names.

Change-Id: Ibd8c7222ed7dfb08d7ea821d871fc6f3b88de24b
'}, {'created': '2017-11-22 00:33:30.000000000', 'message': 'Allow plugins to express dependency info

Add a no-op function, "plugin_requires" to allow plugins to indicate
their dependencies on each other.  This will be used by the Devstack
Ansible module when writing local.conf files.

Also add define_plugin to allow plugins to indicate their canonical
names.

Change-Id: Ibd8c7222ed7dfb08d7ea821d871fc6f3b88de24b
'}]
commit_message:
Allow plugins to express dependency info

Add a no-op function, "plugin_requires" to allow plugins to indicate
their dependencies on each other.  This will be used by the Devstack
Ansible module when writing local.conf files.

Also add define_plugin to allow plugins to indicate their canonical
names.

Change-Id: Ibd8c7222ed7dfb08d7ea821d871fc6f3b88de24b

subject: De-dupe image verification
messages:
[{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-12-07 09:40:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2017-12-07 10:43:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

As discussed on IRC, it's a nasty bug that image_chunks is a list here rather than an iterator. Unfortunately this patch now *requires* image_chunks to be a list rather than an iterator, so would prevent a more serious bug from being fixed.

You can still do with with only a single pass over image_chunks, though. Just requires moving the if statements around a bit."}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-12-07 10:52:11.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Yeah. Turns out this isn't as necessary for the follow-up patch as I thought it was anyway"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-07 09:40:49.000000000', 'message': "De-dupe image verification

There's no reason to be duplicating this code, except the negligible
impact of iterating through image chunks twice. Don't do it and allow us
to greatly simplify a follow-up bugfix. This also allows us to stop
writing a file that we won't later use.

Change-Id: I21d3cb3e131ca720f6d1d886de7114be35da55b1
Related-Bug: #1736759
"}]
commit_message:
De-dupe image verification

There's no reason to be duplicating this code, except the negligible
impact of iterating through image chunks twice. Don't do it and allow us
to greatly simplify a follow-up bugfix. This also allows us to stop
writing a file that we won't later use.

Change-Id: I21d3cb3e131ca720f6d1d886de7114be35da55b1
Related-Bug: #1736759

commit_message:
Function execution concurrency improvement

Increase pod based on the execution rate in qinling-engine so it's
qinling's responsibility to decide when and how to autoscale pod
allocation. This behavior is configurable, the admin user can also
scale up the pod via qinling API manually.

Change-Id: Ie0b01481405daf10f495fa9d6389a624a82f0385
Implements: blueprint qingling-autoscaling

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-27 02:14:51.000000000', 'message': "[Qos] Fix residues of ovs in ingress bw limit

When we delete vm port with attached QoS policy,
it is just doing nothing if vif_port not exists anymore driver.

For ingress bw limit however it's uses additional records in Openvswitch
database: qos and queue. Those records wasn't cleaned in such case.

This patch record port_name in self.ports refer to dscp approach.
Never execute port clear if vif_port not exists. Finally, ovs
driver can clean such qos and queue records

Change-Id: Iddeb49e1e6538a178ca468df0fdf9e0617ca4f1c
Closes-Bug: #1726732

"}, {'created': '2017-11-27 12:13:44.000000000', 'message': '[Qos] Fix residues of ovs in ingress bw limit

When we delete vm port with attached QoS policy,
it is just doing nothing if vif_port does not exist.

This is fine for egress bandwidth limit as it is configured
directly on vif_port in OVS.

For ingress bw limit however it uses additional records in
Openvswitch database: qos and queue. Those records are not
cleaned up in such case.

This patch also records port in self.ports in the case of
bandwidth limit rules, just as in the case of dscp rules.
Never execute port clear if vif_port not exists. Finally, ovs
driver can clean such qos and queue records

Change-Id: Iddeb49e1e6538a178ca468df0fdf9e0617ca4f1c
Closes-Bug: #1726732

commit_message:
[Qos] Fix residues of ovs in ingress bw limit

When we delete vm port with attached QoS policy,
it is just doing nothing if vif_port does not exist.

This is fine for egress bandwidth limit as it is configured
directly on vif_port in OVS.

For ingress bw limit however it uses additional records in
Openvswitch database: qos and queue. Those records are not
cleaned up in such case.

This patch also records port in self.ports in the case of
bandwidth limit rules, just as in the case of dscp rules.
Never execute port clear if vif_port not exists. Finally, ovs
driver can clean such qos and queue records

Change-Id: Iddeb49e1e6538a178ca468df0fdf9e0617ca4f1c
Closes-Bug: #1726732

[{'created': '2017-12-04 14:45:18.000000000', 'message': "Fix HA router initialization exception

When an HA router initialization fails early, it can lead to:

 AttributeError: 'HaRouter' object has no attribute 'process_monitor'

Add init of 'self.process_monitor' in RouterInfo init code in
case we try and cleanup early.

Change-Id: Iddeaeef13adee10f7b130e3f9e584b6e9f037030
Closes-bug: #1735557
(cherry picked from commit c62d54d0c21fc4a760d2ac6501f9493137c5eb8a)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix HA router initialization exception

When an HA router initialization fails early, it can lead to:

 AttributeError: 'HaRouter' object has no attribute 'process_monitor'

Add init of 'self.process_monitor' in RouterInfo init code in
case we try and cleanup early.

Change-Id: Iddeaeef13adee10f7b130e3f9e584b6e9f037030
Closes-bug: #1735557
(cherry picked from commit c62d54d0c21fc4a760d2ac6501f9493137c5eb8a)

(1 comment)

This is a bit OT but something to consider:

There should be a requirement at the project level that part of the adoption process includes evaluating the inclusion of new core contributors for that adopted library. 

We've got a similar requirement for oslo.messaging: in order to get a backend driver adopted there has two be a minimum of two individuals that are responsible for that driver:

https://docs.openstack.org/oslo.messaging/latest/contributor/supported-messaging-drivers.html

It makes sense to apply the same policy at the library level: at least two responsible parties that would also qualify (and be willing) to be the cores for that new library. 

This may be policy already - I couldn't find anything relevant online.

If folks think this is A Good Idea then perhaps the template should include a requirement of at least 2 individuals for the Author(s) section and that they should be willing to become cores?"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2017-07-13 17:40:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > This is a bit OT but something to consider:
 > 
 > There should be a requirement at the project level that part of the
 > adoption process includes evaluating the inclusion of new core
 > contributors for that adopted library.

+1000

New code needs to come with maintainers.

 > This may be policy already - I couldn't find anything relevant
 > online.

In the past we encouraged it, but did not require it. I think it makes sense to require it.

 > If folks think this is A Good Idea then perhaps the template should
 > include a requirement of at least 2 individuals for the Author(s)
 > section and that they should be willing to become cores?

+1

Voting -1 on the spec, pending these proposed updates."}, {'account_id': 9796, 'date': '2017-07-14 02:01:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Code-Review

commit_message:
Add a new library policy and process proposal

Quite often Oslo is requested to create (or adopt) new libraries
for various purposes and it would be good to (as a group) have a
stance on new libraries and the process they need to go through
to either become a new library in Oslo or to become a new library
that is independently maintained on pypi.

Co-Authored-By: ChangBo Guo(gcb) <eric.guo@easystack.cn>
Change-Id: Ib1ed8aad4859ca8313ac841fb9a57db1d08a2f10

commit_message:
Remove the bundled intree neutron tempest plugin

The plugin has been split into its own repository[1] in accordance with
Queens Goal "Split Tempest Plugins into Separate Repos/Projects[2]".
This patch removes the local copy as well as the setuptools entry point.
We can also now remove the autodoc_tree_excludes pbr option since
there's no more plugin to exclude and it defaults to [setup.py].

The patch leaves still in-tree base classes and constants in order to
avoid breakage of projects depending on such code. In the future, we
will deprecate those and gradually move affected subprojects to the new
repo.

List of affected repositories:
 - neutron-vpnaas
 - openstack-ansible-os_neutron
 - tripleo-quickstart-extras
 - networking-midonet
 - networking-l2gw
 - neutron-dynamic-routing
 - networking-vsphere
 - networking-plumgrid
 - networking-zvm

[1] http://git.openstack.org/cgit/openstack/neutron-tempest-plugin
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/queens/split-tempest-plugins.html

Depends-On: I371aa4d5f043f695df04b98b0f485c8f0548f2b3

Change-Id: Ia21aad29d0bbf779583964db6f1665c9b3b83161

commit_message:
Update swift templates for rsync_module

With the current templates, the rsync_module is left as the default value,
which has not {meta} included. Setting sync_module has no effect.

References:
https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/etc/container-server.conf-sample
https://github.com/openstack/swift/blob/master/swift/obj/replicator.py#89

Change these templates to set rsync_module instead.

Change-Id: I14773a09013b90dd2dd68110173eab1d3ccec3de

commit_message:
Add container action object and sql db api

commit_message:
Fix ansible lint tests

On top of that, it bumps the version of bindep.txt
from the osa-tests repo, because the automatic bump
cannot merge without lint tests passing, and the
other way around. Moreover, we drop the 'force'
argument from zypper since we are not switching
package vendors anymore.

[hwoarang: Add patch from https://review.openstack.org/#/c/526128/
to unblock the gates]

Depends-On: I4ba16ea660907c3fb481a9e80d73b750c2f4c138
Change-Id: I67e44434d4b3eb07b8af5c12aaa807514518be4c

The hostname of the build machine leaks in heat.conf in the host
directive, making the whole heat package not reproducible. If you don't
know about reproducibility, please read here:
https://wiki.debian.org/ReproducibleBuilds/About

This patch therefore sets sample_default to avoid this problem.

"}]
commit_message:
Build heat.conf reproducibly

The hostname of the build machine leaks in heat.conf in the host
directive, making the whole heat package not reproducible. If you don't
know about reproducibility, please read here:
https://wiki.debian.org/ReproducibleBuilds/About

This patch therefore sets sample_default to avoid this problem.

Change-Id: Ibfe81f89df75417eab7437817aabd69bfb2985cd
Closes-Bug: #1736761

messages: [{'account_id': 7353, 'date': '2017-12-06 19:58:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 290, 'date': '2017-12-06 22:46:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 14805, 'date': '2017-12-07 05:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-12-07 09:03:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 19:58:47.000000000', 'message': 'SUSE: Drop OBS repositories for openSUSE Leap < 42.3

We were installing additional repos for the apt-cacher-ng and
liberasurecode packages which are only necessary for Leap < 42.3.
However, < 42.3 is now EOL so lets drop these repositories since we
can fetch these packages from the default repos in 42.3

Change-Id: I4ba16ea660907c3fb481a9e80d73b750c2f4c138
'}]
commit_message:
SUSE: Drop OBS repositories for openSUSE Leap < 42.3

We were installing additional repos for the apt-cacher-ng and
liberasurecode packages which are only necessary for Leap < 42.3.
However, < 42.3 is now EOL so lets drop these repositories since we
can fetch these packages from the default repos in 42.3

Change-Id: I4ba16ea660907c3fb481a9e80d73b750c2f4c138

commit_message:
Add missing hostnames to fluentd log messages

- Sets the hostname on rabbitmq and mariadb log messages
  according to the local host.
- Sets the hostname on syslog log messages by extracting it
  from the syslog message. In many cases this will be the
  same as the local host, but it may also be a remote host.

Closes-Bug: #1726596
Change-Id: If7c53916d5a355b3aac33d6a62d89d02474e8b53

commit_message:
Zuul: add file extension to playbook path

Zuul now supports including the file extension on the playbook path
and omitting the extension is now deprecrated.  Update references
to include the extension.

Change-Id: I8e5a6c12ce817bfae597f7de89e7825b5512fb6c

commit_message:
Migrate to using ansible for endpoint creation

This patch replaces the `openstack` commands with an ansible playbook.

Change-Id: I0bc5b86074e9a4cc204fd807e1a361d5f9f184e2

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2017-10-09 07:20:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Christian, sorry for forgetting to response this question:
>>>Have you already prepare a patch for the docker images? to include the xenapi dom0 stuff from https://github.com/openstack/os-xenapi/tree/master/os_xenapi/dom0?

os-xenapi is defined as the dependence package for nova, so I thought that would be installed automatically as the dependence of base nova package. That's true for source installation and binary installation with Ubuntu as python-nova is declared depending on python-os-xenapi. But you're right, we have to install it for binary installation on CentOS (I guess also needed by other RDO).
Thanks for having pointed it out.

BTW: @naichuan is adding some other packages needed by XenAPI in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/510266/."}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2017-10-09 07:22:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-09-28 14:57:37.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI: support XenServer deployment.

This contains the following chanages to support XenServer:

1. XenAPI is the virt type for XenServer, add XenAPI as the new option
for nova_compute_virt_type

2. Customize the service configuration for XenAPI

3. Create a new role for XenAPI:
In XenServer, there is a privileged domain which is known as dom0; and
it can run a number of un-privileged domains which is known as domU.
The OpenStack services run in domU. Some compute relative services
(e.g nova-compute, neutron-openvswitch-agent, ceilometer-compute) run
in a domU but need communicate with dom0 to performance some hyperviosr
operations: e.g. boot VMs; controler dom0' openvswitch; query metrics data.
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

These services use XenAPI to communicate with dom0 through the
host internal management network (HIMN). When preparing the VMs where
the OpenStack compute services will run on, we can use the XenCenter's
HIMN plugin to create this network and attach the VM to this network
from XenCenter - https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin.

So besides the common tasks, we need some additional tasks for XenAPI:
- detect the interface connected to HIMN in domU;
- install XAPI plugins to dom0;
- install packages to dom0;
- configure iptables to allow the traffic between dom0 and OpenStack endpoits.
- etc.

The above operations will be implemented via tools belong a separate package.
But we need a new role to hold these tasks which invoke those tools. This
commit created a new role named as nova-xenapi which will be applied at early
phase so that the needed preperation work completed before other common
deployment start.

4. Add a new neutron-openvswitch-agent service:
For XenServer, we need two instances of L2Agent (neutron-openvswitch-agent
service): one manage the OpenvSwitches in domU and the other manage the
OpenvSwitches located in dom0.
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/matelakat/shared/xs-q-v1/xenserver-quantum/deployment.png

So we propose to add a new neutron-openvswitch-agent service which manages
a remote host (it's dom0 for XenServer); the new service will use the same
docker image as the existing one but the ml2 configure file need to be
customized so that it can manage the remote host properly.

Change-Id: Id34d247ab78976627f8e70685f27470b254cd418
blueprint: xenserver-support

1. XenAPI is the virt type for XenServer, add XenAPI as the new option
for nova_compute_virt_type

2. Customize the service configuration for XenAPI

operations: e.g. boot VMs; controler dom0' openvswitch; query metrics data.
https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html

These services use XenAPI to communicate with dom0 through the
host internal management network (HIMN). When preparing the VMs where
the OpenStack compute services will run on, we can use the XenCenter's
HIMN plugin to create this network and attach the VM to this network
from XenCenter - https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin.

So besides the common tasks, we need some additional tasks for XenAPI:
- detect the interface connected to HIMN in domU;
- install XAPI plugins to dom0;
- install packages to dom0;
- configure iptables to allow the traffic between dom0 and OpenStack endpoits.
- etc.

The above operations will be implemented via tools belong a separate package.
But we need a new role to hold these tasks which invoke those tools. This
commit created a new role named as nova-xenapi which will be applied at early
phase so that the needed preperation work completed before other common
deployment start.

4. Add a new neutron-openvswitch-agent service:
For XenServer, besides the default neutron-openvswitch-agent service which
manage locally manage the Open vSwitches located in the target host where
the service runs on, it also requires another instance of the service of
neutron-openvswitch-agent which remotely manage the Open vSwitches located
in dom0.
https://raw.githubusercontent.com/matelakat/shared/xs-q-v1/xenserver-quantum/deployment.png

So we propose to add a new neutron-openvswitch-agent-xenapi service which
manages the ovs in dom0 for XenServer, the new service will use the same
docker image as the existing one but the ml2 configure file need to be
customized so that it can manage the remote host properly.

Change-Id: Id34d247ab78976627f8e70685f27470b254cd418

"}, {'created': '2017-12-05 07:36:56.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI: support XenAPI in nova configuration

When using XenAPI as the virt driver, we need some XenAPI
specific configure options. This commit is to ensure nova's
configuration can be generated correctly for XenAPI. It
includes the folowing changes:
* Add XenAPI as one of the valid options for nova_compute_virt_type;
* Configure some options when XenAPI is chosen as the virt type.

This commit does NOT include the host and [vnc] configurations which
will be covered by a following commit.

References:
* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html
* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin
* nova configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/configuration/config.html

Change-Id: Id34d247ab78976627f8e70685f27470b254cd418
blueprint: xenserver-support
"}]
commit_message:
XenAPI: support XenAPI in nova configuration

When using XenAPI as the virt driver, we need some XenAPI
specific configure options. This commit is to ensure nova's
configuration can be generated correctly for XenAPI. It
includes the folowing changes:
* Add XenAPI as one of the valid options for nova_compute_virt_type;
* Configure some options when XenAPI is chosen as the virt type.

This commit does NOT include the host and [vnc] configurations which
will be covered by a following commit.

References:
* XenServer (and other XAPI based Xen variants):
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/admin/configuration/hypervisor-xen-api.html
* XenCenter HIMN plugin (adding HIMN network which is used by XenAPI driver to
  communicate with XenServer):
  https://github.com/citrix-openstack/xencenter-himn-plugin
* nova configuration options:
  https://docs.openstack.org/nova/pike/configuration/config.html

Change-Id: Id34d247ab78976627f8e70685f27470b254cd418
blueprint: xenserver-support

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-10 18:05:58.000000000', 'message': "Preserve X-Static-Large-Object from .data file after POST

You can't modify the X-Static-Large-Object metadata with a POST, an
object being a SLO is a property of the .data file.  Revert the change
from 4500ff which attempts to correctly handle X-Static-Large-Object
metadata on a POST, but is subject to a race if the most recent SLO
.data isn't available during the POST.  Instead this change adjusts the
reading of metadata such that the X-Static-Large-Object metadata is
always preserved from the metadata on the datafile and bleeds through
a .meta if any.

Closes-bug: #1453807
Closes-bug: #1634723

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: Ie48a38442559229a2993443ab0a04dc84717ca59
(cherry picked from commit 36a843be73e2d58c3fe49a049d514b421124bd06)
"}]
commit_message:
Preserve X-Static-Large-Object from .data file after POST

You can't modify the X-Static-Large-Object metadata with a POST, an
object being a SLO is a property of the .data file.  Revert the change
from 4500ff which attempts to correctly handle X-Static-Large-Object
metadata on a POST, but is subject to a race if the most recent SLO
.data isn't available during the POST.  Instead this change adjusts the
reading of metadata such that the X-Static-Large-Object metadata is
always preserved from the metadata on the datafile and bleeds through
a .meta if any.

Closes-bug: #1453807
Closes-bug: #1634723

Co-Authored-By: Kota Tsuyuzaki <tsuyuzaki.kota@lab.ntt.co.jp>
Change-Id: Ie48a38442559229a2993443ab0a04dc84717ca59
(cherry picked from commit 36a843be73e2d58c3fe49a049d514b421124bd06)

Preserve X-Static-Large-Object from .data file after POST

You can't modify the X-Static-Large-Object metadata with a POST, an
object being a SLO is a property of the .data file.  Revert the change
from 4500ff which attempts to correctly handle X-Static-Large-Object
metadata on a POST, but is subject to a race if the most recent SLO
.data isn't available during the POST.  Instead this change adjusts the
reading of metadata such that the X-Static-Large-Object metadata is
always preserved from the metadata on the datafile and bleeds through
a .meta if any.

Closes-bug: #1453807
Closes-bug: #1634723

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-17 00:56:06.000000000', 'message': 'Use "poll" or "selects" Eventlet hub for all Swift daemons.

Previously, Swift's WSGI servers, the object replicator, and the
object reconstructor were setting Eventlet's hub to either "poll" or
"selects", depending on availability. Other daemons were letting
Eventlet use its default hub, which is "epoll".

In any daemons that fork, we really don't want to use epoll. Epoll
instances end up shared between the parent and all children, and you
get some awful messes when file descriptors are shared.

Here's an example where two processes are trying to wait on the same
file descriptor using the same epoll instance, and everything goes
wrong:

[proc A] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = 0

[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = -1 EEXIST (File exists)
[proc B] epoll_wait(6, ...) = 1
[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_DEL, 3, ...) = 0

[proc A] epoll_wait(6, ...)

This primarily affects the container updater and object updater since
they fork. I've decided to change the hub for all Swift daemons so
that we don't add multiprocessing support to some other daemon someday
and suffer through this same bug again.

This problem was made more apparent by commit 6d16079, which made our
logging mutex use file descriptors. However, it could have struck on
any shared file descriptor on which a read or write returned EAGAIN.

Change-Id: Iebc1491f2ed86ed0db9e7eb0e3277c88076225e1
'}]
commit_message:
Use "poll" or "selects" Eventlet hub for all Swift daemons.

Previously, Swift's WSGI servers, the object replicator, and the
object reconstructor were setting Eventlet's hub to either "poll" or
"selects", depending on availability. Other daemons were letting
Eventlet use its default hub, which is "epoll".

In any daemons that fork, we really don't want to use epoll. Epoll
instances end up shared between the parent and all children, and you
get some awful messes when file descriptors are shared.

Here's an example where two processes are trying to wait on the same
file descriptor using the same epoll instance, and everything goes
wrong:

[proc A] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = 0

[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_ADD, 3, ...) = -1 EEXIST (File exists)
[proc B] epoll_wait(6, ...) = 1
[proc B] epoll_ctl(6, EPOLL_CTL_DEL, 3, ...) = 0

[proc A] epoll_wait(6, ...)

This primarily affects the container updater and object updater since
they fork. I've decided to change the hub for all Swift daemons so
that we don't add multiprocessing support to some other daemon someday
and suffer through this same bug again.

This problem was made more apparent by commit 6d16079, which made our
logging mutex use file descriptors. However, it could have struck on
any shared file descriptor on which a read or write returned EAGAIN.

Change-Id: Iebc1491f2ed86ed0db9e7eb0e3277c88076225e1

Burst value for TCP traffic can be set as 80% of desired bandwidth
limit value. For example, if the bandwidth limit is set to 1000kbps
then enough burst value will be 800kbit. If the configured burst value
is too low, achieved bandwidth limit will be lower than expected.
If the configured burst value is too high, too few packets could
be limited and achieved bandwidth limit would be higher than expected.

So we should recommend a correct example in case that user ignores
the note.

Change-Id: Iefea3ce699c39e217e89dec93a8fe8ea1a90ac82

commit_message:
burst should be set near max-rate

Burst value for TCP traffic should be set as 80% of desired bandwidth
limit value. For example, if the bandwidth limit is set to 1000kbps
then enough burst value will be 800kbit. If the configured burst value
is too low, achieved bandwidth limit will be lower than expected.
If the configured burst value is too high, too few packets could
be limited and achieved bandwidth limit would be higher than expected.

So we should recommend a correct example in case that user ignores
the note.

Change-Id: Iefea3ce699c39e217e89dec93a8fe8ea1a90ac82

commit_message:
Add CREATE_PRECOMMIT notification for Floating IPs

This patch is adding a CREATE_PRECOMMIT notification for floating ips.
Before it was possible to register a callback for that (no errors) but
the notification would never be sent because the code was simple not in
place.

Closes-Bug: #1736201
Change-Id: If901d4d54118a6343597ab2ad075b6a2399ea62c

commit_message:
placement: allow filter providers in tree

Adds a new 'in_tree' filter parameter to the
ResourceProviderList.get_all_by_filters() method. This parameter allows
the caller to get providers in the "provider tree" of a supplied
provider UUID.

Change-Id: If35ee6a90ca0a999f6c4815e6f5e99d9962dcc46
blueprint: nested-resource-providers

commit_message:
Persist role in a path discoverable by ansible

This persists the role in /usr/share/ansible/roles/tripleo-ipsec
which should be discoverable by ansible.

Change-Id: I46c1d701a4f486cf4a2fed857c0cb9f4aa3a2f64

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-31 18:25:28.000000000', 'message': "Test non-destructive upgrade for deprecated res types

We have a test that is designed to check that we can upgrade from a
deprecated resource type to an equivalent-but-differently-named one (e.g.
from OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments to OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup),
but in the test we don't compare the physical IDs of the resource that is
potentially getting replaced, but rather the physical IDs of some other
resource that can't possibly get modified (surprise! it doesn't change).
Change the test to examine the correct resource.

Change-Id: I75778abc303525a71d0a918f7192f00a43c21284
"}, {'created': '2017-11-01 14:07:22.000000000', 'message': "Test non-destructive upgrade for deprecated res types

We have a test that is designed to check that we can upgrade from a
deprecated resource type to an equivalent-but-differently-named one (e.g.
from OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments to OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup),
but in the test we don't compare the physical IDs of the resource that is
potentially getting replaced, but rather the physical IDs of some other
resource that can't possibly get modified (surprise! it doesn't change).
Change the test to examine the correct resource.

Change-Id: I75778abc303525a71d0a918f7192f00a43c21284
"}, {'created': '2017-11-01 22:08:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix non-destructive upgrade for deprecated res types in convergence

When a user updates from a deprecated resource type to an
equivalent-but-differently-named one (e.g. from
OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments to OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup), Heat
is supposed to change the type without replacing the resource as it would
normally do when a resource type changes. This was broken in convergence,
because since 45073226752c58d640ea5a59b7e532c022a4939b the new Resource
object we create during the check_resource operation (using the new type's
plugin) is no longer automatically initialised with data from the database
as resources in the legacy path are.

Move the substitution checking to the Resource.load() method, so that it
now returns an instance of the new plugin where allowed. In the actual
update_convergence() method then we need only check that the resource class
is the one we'd expect from the new template, and replace the resource if
not.

We do have a test that is designed to check that this is working, but in it
we didn't compare the physical IDs of the resource that is potentially
getting replaced, but rather the physical IDs of some other resource that
can't possibly get modified (surprise! it doesn't change).

Change-Id: I75778abc303525a71d0a918f7192f00a43c21284
Closes-Bug: #1729439
"}]
commit_message:
Fix non-destructive upgrade for deprecated res types in convergence

When a user updates from a deprecated resource type to an
equivalent-but-differently-named one (e.g. from
OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployments to OS::Heat::SoftwareDeploymentGroup), Heat
is supposed to change the type without replacing the resource as it would
normally do when a resource type changes. This was broken in convergence,
because since 45073226752c58d640ea5a59b7e532c022a4939b the new Resource
object we create during the check_resource operation (using the new type's
plugin) is no longer automatically initialised with data from the database
as resources in the legacy path are.

Move the substitution checking to the Resource.load() method, so that it
now returns an instance of the new plugin where allowed. In the actual
update_convergence() method then we need only check that the resource class
is the one we'd expect from the new template, and replace the resource if
not.

We do have a test that is designed to check that this is working, but in it
we didn't compare the physical IDs of the resource that is potentially
getting replaced, but rather the physical IDs of some other resource that
can't possibly get modified (surprise! it doesn't change).

Change-Id: I75778abc303525a71d0a918f7192f00a43c21284
Closes-Bug: #1729439

'}, {'created': '2017-11-30 20:52:49.000000000', 'message': 'Instance HA support

This commit is the puppet-tripleo part that implements the instance HA
spec. It only adds a couple of pacemaker resources and stonith devices
when instance HA is activated via an environment variable.

The compute nodes that take part in instance HA need to have the
following services added to them:
OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeInstanceHA
OS::TripleO::Services::PacemakerRemote

More detailed info will be added to the docs.

blueprint instance-ha

Change-Id: I4d1908242e9513a225d2b1da06ed4ee769ee10f7

commit_message:
Instance HA support

This commit is the puppet-tripleo part that implements the instance HA
spec. It only adds a couple of pacemaker resources and stonith devices
when instance HA is activated via an environment variable.

The compute nodes that take part in instance HA need to have the
following services added to them:
OS::TripleO::Services::ComputeInstanceHA
OS::TripleO::Services::PacemakerRemote

More detailed info will be added to the docs.

blueprint instance-ha

Change-Id: I4d1908242e9513a225d2b1da06ed4ee769ee10f7

(1 comment)

Personally I'd prefer to see a more pluggable approach to including arbitrary roles, e.g could we use the deploy_steps_tasks and do include_role?

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/522344/"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-04 20:10:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27253, 'date': '2017-12-04 21:00:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Personally I'd prefer to see a more pluggable approach to including
 > arbitrary roles, e.g could we use the deploy_steps_tasks and do
 > include_role?
 
That would be inline with where Ansible is moving: we're trying to pare down play-level keywords, e.g., roles, post_tasks, pre_tasks, and move everything into tasks. It's makes execution order much more straightforward.

So an import_role task using a loop that is fed by a variable would fit into the existing capability to run Ansible tasks. We could also make the task conditional by defaulting to an empty list."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2017-12-06 02:49:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:38:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:39:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
deploy-steps.j2: use ansible to bootstrap environment

We introduced a new Ansible role, tripleo-bootstrap:
I560273be2ebe3a49ff37e3682222706939e5d879

This role will take care of preparing an environment that will deploy
TripleO later.
This patch aims to use execute this new role on all hosts.
We don't gather_facts, (already gathered previously), we want to fail on
any error and also the role will be executed on pre_deploy_steps tag.

Change-Id: If9306473701a340d577bbe0a4a7dfee90be99c2f
Depends-On: I560273be2ebe3a49ff37e3682222706939e5d879

commit_message:
Fix loop in config-download.yaml.j2 template

We need 2 separate loops here, otherwise when deploying with multiple
subnodes, you get the DeployedServerPortMap parameter repeated which
means only the last would take effect.

Also fixes the hardcoding of the hostname and ip address using the
special jinja2 loop.index0 variable.[1]

[1] http://jinja.pocoo.org/docs/2.10/templates/#for

Change-Id: I020c0b690b9848b53e468c67e91d6659eb6bb619

commit_message:
To make etcd models object more like a dict.

Add items iteritems and keys functions in etcd.models:Base to
make the etcd model object more like a dict. When we need pass
the dict object, we don't need use model.as_dict any more, pass
the model object will be ok. Just like the way we use sql model
object.

Change-Id: Ic4d7e1c1cc266ee6d265b56e0ab56643ec86105a

commit_message:
Put test-requirements into an extra named 'test'

In bindep files we use a 'test' environment to indicate dependencies
that are needed for testing. Make the same thing available for our
python dependencies, allowing things like "pip install .[test]" or "pip
install shade[test]" to work.

Change-Id: If3ad8b6a79a8cab2f7434b73207f35384e8516ba

commit_message:
Pin API version during rolling upgrade

During a rolling upgrade, when the new services are pinned to the
old release, the API version will also be pinned to the old release.
This will prevent users from accessing new features that may not quite
work.

The .sample was updated to reflect the change to the help string for
the [DEFAULT]/pin_release_version configuration option. The update also
pulled in changes for other options, from other (non-ironic) libraries.

Change-Id: I38a0f106b589945fb62071f3dfe5bff43c6fee93
Partial-Bug: #1708549

subject: OVN: Remove container-attribute-target=host from the ovn_dbs_bundle
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 10237, 'name': 'Numan Siddique', 'email': 'nusiddiq@redhat.com', 'username': 'numansiddique'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-12-04 11:15:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2017-12-04 11:25:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Numan,

you probably do not want to do this, but instead fix the RA like we did here: https://github.com/ClusterLabs/resource-agents/commit/9bd94137d77f770967d35db5de716590cfaf0435

Doing this change means that you will use the bundle name in the OVN RA. If you use this bundle name to store any property or data, things can break as soon as one node dies because you have no guarantee that bundle-name == host-name. (I.e. if you store a property on bundle-1 when it was running on node-1, a cluster change might move bundle-1 to node-0 and now you're property probably makes no sense)"}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-12-04 15:26:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Hi Numan,
 > 
 > you probably do not want to do this, but instead fix the RA like we
 > did here: https://github.com/ClusterLabs/resource-agents/commit/9bd94137d77f770967d35db5de716590cfaf0435
 > 
 > Doing this change means that you will use the bundle name in the
 > OVN RA. If you use this bundle name to store any property or data,
 > things can break as soon as one node dies because you have no
 > guarantee that bundle-name == host-name. (I.e. if you store a
 > property on bundle-1 when it was running on node-1, a cluster
 > change might move bundle-1 to node-0 and now you're property
 > probably makes no sense)

Thanks Michele. I will do as per your suggestion.
The present situation is that - with tripleo master, OVN db bundle resource would not work. And the RA patch would be available in OVS 2.9. Is it fine to have this patch now with a clear note that in the comment that this should be reverted ? and get it reverted when OVS 2.9 is available in RDO ?

Does this seem reasonable to you ? If s, I can update the patch with a clear note and with the promise to get it fixed in OVN RA :).

Thanks for the review"}, {'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2017-12-07 07:10:39.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-04 11:15:53.000000000', 'message': "OVN: Remove container-attribute-target=host from the ovn_dbs_bundle

The commit with change id I0dd06e953b4c81f217d0f4199b2337e4c3358086 added the
meta param 'container-attribute-target=host' in the ovn-dbs-bundle resource.
Because of this the pacemaker is not promoting any node to master.

Looks like we have to address this issue in OVN OCF script [1]. But not setting
this param, also seems to work fine. So, not sure if we really need to do anything.

This patch removes this param.
[1] - https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/ovn/utilities/ovndb-servers.ocf
Change-Id: I4897e1b9ae9c6feef8db68b62124b2bdb5f65a5b
"}]
commit_message:
OVN: Remove container-attribute-target=host from the ovn_dbs_bundle

The commit with change id I0dd06e953b4c81f217d0f4199b2337e4c3358086 added the
meta param 'container-attribute-target=host' in the ovn-dbs-bundle resource.
Because of this the pacemaker is not promoting any node to master.

Looks like we have to address this issue in OVN OCF script [1]. But not setting
this param, also seems to work fine. So, not sure if we really need to do anything.

This patch removes this param.
[1] - https://github.com/openvswitch/ovs/blob/master/ovn/utilities/ovndb-servers.ocf
Change-Id: I4897e1b9ae9c6feef8db68b62124b2bdb5f65a5b

> Hi He Qing,
 > 
 > I don't see any linked Launchpad so I have to ask for a scenario to
 > reproduce this.

Thank you for your review. Yes, there isn't a launchpad bug related yet.
I proposaled this because sometimes amphora agent API returned an error, after that taskflow reverted and amphorae were deleted. We'll never have a chance to find out what's going wrong exactly.

Acturally amphora agent API already provided detail information about errors, we just print it to log file."}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2017-04-25 07:12:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

This is helpful for finding out the reason about exceptions

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2017-10-13 13:42:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 18.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-10-13 14:42:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 18: Code-Review-1

My concern about the CachingScheduler limits from PS17 still apply.

To clarify, the CachingScheduler does not use Placement to filter hosts by the standard VCPU, MEMORY_MB and DISK_GB resource classes. The FilterScheduler does and is the default - which is why we removed the RamFilter and DiskFilter from the default list of enabled filters - because they are redundant with the filtering done in Placement if you're using the FilterScheduler.

However, because CachingScheduler isn't using Placement, it's going to rely on claims in the compute service via the ResourceTracker, and those claims rely on the limits dict having values passed down from the scheduler, and that limits dict gets populated in the various filters, including CoreFilter, RamFilter and DiskFilter. So if you're using the CachingScheduler, which people still are because we haven't shown that FilterScheduler + Placement outperforms CachingScheduler at scale, nor is the CachingScheduler deprecated yet for that same reason, that means those people are probably going to have the CoreFilter, RamFilter and DiskFilter (depending on shared storage or not) enabled and rely on those limits getting passed from the scheduler to the compute for the limit claim check in the RT.

Hence, you can't just not allow vcpu/memory_mb/disk_gb limits in this Selection object without breaking the CachingScheduler - which is my concern.

Make sense?"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-13 15:33:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18: Verified+1

I think we at least need to discuss the format of the limits dict before moving forward on this, as it will potentially break out of tree filters that are putting in their own limits. However, any out of tree filter that is relying on custom limits must also have custom code in the resource tracker / claim code, which isn't something we support as an extension (like we don't have the extendable resource tracker)."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-10-23 15:37:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 22:

> However, any out of tree filter that is relying on custom limits must also have custom code in the resource tracker / claim code, which isn't something we support as an extension (like we don't have the extendable resource tracker).

Given that, I think it's OK to restrict the limits field value to only things that we know about for in-tree filters and how limits are used in the claim/resource tracker code. Filters are pluggable, but the resource tracker is not."}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2017-10-24 15:57:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 23: Patch Set 22 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2017-10-24 20:27:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-08-30 17:31:23.000000000', 'message': "WIP - Add ${Destination} and ${Destination}List objects

NOTE: After creating this, I discovered that there is an object named
'Destination' in the RequestSpec, so we'll need to bikeshed on a
different name for these things. But as a POC I'm posting this, changing
every 'destination' to 'xdestination' as a placeholder until a better
name can be agreed upon.

The $Destination object incorporates the information returned from the
scheduler into an object that is cleaner to pass over RPC, and which
allows versioning of any changes to this data. The $DestinationList
object is an iterator, allowing the cell conductor to loop over its
destinations until it either succeeds with a build or runs out of
destinations.

Blueprint: return-destination-objects

Change-Id: Ic135752bcee73f8b5fc73a8df785c698c16ac324

commit_message:
Add Selection objects

The Selection object incorporates the information returned from the
scheduler into an object that is cleaner to pass over RPC, and which
allows versioning of any changes to this data.

Blueprint: return-alternate-hosts

Change-Id: Ic135752bcee73f8b5fc73a8df785c698c16ac324

[{'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2017-11-24 11:47:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2017-11-24 14:41:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2017-11-27 09:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2017-12-01 06:39:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Published edit on patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2017-12-01 06:41:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Published edit on patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2017-12-01 20:56:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Thanks for the patches Venkata. We have users tripping over this in the field so it's very much appreciated as it is a high-impact issue.

This mostly looks good to me. I'm curious though why the code for updating HA network port status to down was moved to get_service_plugin_list() vs putting it at the end of __init__(). I'm not overly familiar with this code so I'm probably missing something. The pike and queens patches call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses() at the end of __init__().

Also the commit message doesn't match the ocata code. That may be ok for a cherry-pick though, I'm not sure. It seems that appending the commit with a few notes describing the code changes due to conflicts might be good."}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2017-12-04 13:22:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2017-12-04 13:24:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thanks Corey Bryant. I have updated the commit message with the explanation.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2017-12-04 13:27:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2017-12-04 16:29:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

I guess this is a good a way as any to fix this in ocata.'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-12-04 19:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 10267, 'date': '2017-12-06 07:53:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2017-12-06 15:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I think you need to update conflicts in your commit message with the unit test file.'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:04:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:05:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> I think you need to update conflicts in your commit message with
 > the unit test file.

No, because it's not git conflict, it's a change needed to adopt the patch to the branch. It didn't trigger a conflict though. I usually describe those changes in a separate new section in commit message called 'Local changes' / '<Branch-name> changes' so that reviewers have additional context, but it's just me."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11805, 'date': '2017-12-06 16:23:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

@Ihar got it, thanks. LGTM'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-24 11:47:55.000000000', 'message': 'Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

As explained in bug [1] when l3 agent fails to report state to the
server, its state is set to AGENT_REVIVED, triggering
fetch_and_sync_all_routers, which will set all its HA network ports
to DOWN, resulting in
1) ovs agent rewiring these ports and setting status to ACTIVE
2) when these ports are active, server sends router update to l3 agent
As server, ovs and l3 agents are busy with this processing, l3 agent
may fail again reporting state, repeating this process.

As l3 agent is repeatedly processing same routers, SIGHUPs are
frequently sent to keepalived, resulting in multiple masters.

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent
start instead of calling from fetch_and_sync_all_routers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1731595/comments/7
Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
        neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py

commit_message:
Call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses on agent start

As explained in bug [1] when l3 agent fails to report state to the
server, its state is set to AGENT_REVIVED, triggering
fetch_and_sync_all_routers, which will set all its HA network ports
to DOWN, resulting in
1) ovs agent rewiring these ports and setting status to ACTIVE
2) when these ports are active, server sends router update to l3 agent
As server, ovs and l3 agents are busy with this processing, l3 agent
may fail again reporting state, repeating this process.

As l3 agent is repeatedly processing same routers, SIGHUPs are
frequently sent to keepalived, resulting in multiple masters.

To fix this, we call update_all_ha_network_port_statuses in l3 agent
start instead of calling from fetch_and_sync_all_routers.

[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1731595/comments/7
Conflicts:
	neutron/agent/l3/agent.py
        neutron/api/rpc/handlers/l3_rpc.py

Note: This RPC update_all_ha_network_port_statuses is added in only pike
and later branches. In older branches, we were using get_router_ids RPC
to invoke _update_ha_network_port_status. As we need to invoke this
functionality during l3 agent start and get_service_plugin_list() is the
only available RPC which is called during l3 agent start, we call
_update_ha_network_port_status from get_service_plugin_list.

Change-Id: Ia9d5549f7d53b538c9c9f93fe6aa71ffff15524a
Related-bug: #1597461
Closes-Bug: #1731595
(cherry picked from commit 9ab1ad1433d54fec3e5b04f1edf8ca436e1f7af1)
(cherry picked from commit a6d985bbca57b5027eecaa43071964b14d9075d9)

commit_message:
Just use 'import mock' for all mock versions

It's apparently not needed anymore to try to use the
various locations of mock depending on where it may exist,
so let's just stick to using it from the pypi library.

Change-Id: I4650ff0b19f09005d7f9d4b6184e2f7d3c9046bf

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-30 08:56:45.000000000', 'message': 'XenAPI: provide vGPU inventory in compute node

This commit is to create inventory data for virtual GPU(vGPU)
basing on the host_stats reported by XenAPI. The final target
is to create child resource providers under the compute node
for each GPU group (XenAPI manages the same type of physical
GPU in one GPU group), so that we can associate traits to the
resource provider. Then users can consume vGPU from different
resourc providers(representing GPU groups) basing on specific
traits. But at the moment, the nested resource provider is still
in progress of development. So the decision is to firstly implement
a simple vGPU feature by including vGPU resource in compute node's
inventory.

As compute node is the only resource provider for the vGPUs, in
the resoure provider we can't determine which group the vGPUs belong
to. So we will treat all vGPU as the same.
For example, if one compute node has two types of GPUs: e.g.
"NVIDIA K1" which can supply 4 vGPUs with the type of "Grid K180Q";
and 'Intel Iris Pro Graphics P6300" which can supply 7 vGPUs with
the type of "Intel GVT-g". The total amount of the resource class
of "VGPU" in the inventory is 4 + 7 = 11.

Once we switch to use nestes resource providers, we can create
inventory under different child resource providers for each
GPU group. Then we can schedule resource providers basing on
traits.

Change-Id: Iba4fcb82dd18e8c1f22d0ce3358078c5263c77dc
blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu

GPU in one GPU group), so that we can associate traits to the
resource provider. Then users can consume vGPU from different
resource providers(representing GPU groups) basing on specific
traits. But at the moment, the nested resource provider is still
in progress of development. So the decision is to firstly implement
a simple vGPU feature by including vGPU resource in compute node's
inventory.

As compute node is the only resource provider for the vGPUs, in
the resource provider we can't determine which group the vGPUs belong
to. So we will treat all vGPU as the same.
For example, if one compute node has two types of GPUs: e.g.
"NVIDIA K1" which can supply 4 vGPUs with the type of "Grid K180Q";
and 'Intel Iris Pro Graphics P6300" which can supply 7 vGPUs with
the type of "Intel GVT-g". The total amount of the resource class
of "VGPU" in the inventory is 4 + 7 = 11.

Once we switch to use nested resource providers, we can create
inventory under different child resource providers for each
GPU group. Then we can schedule resource providers basing on
traits.

Change-Id: Iba4fcb82dd18e8c1f22d0ce3358078c5263c77dc
blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu

commit_message:
XenAPI: provide vGPU inventory in compute node

This commit is to create inventory data for virtual GPU(vGPU)
basing on the host_stats reported by XenAPI. The final target
is to create child resource providers under the compute node
for each GPU group (XenAPI manages the same type of physical
GPU in one GPU group), so that we can support multiple GPUs which
have different traits. Then users can consume vGPU from different
resource providers(representing GPU groups) basing on specific
traits. But at the moment, the nested resource provider is still
in progress of development. So the decision is to firstly implement
a simple vGPU feature by including vGPU resource in compute node's
inventory.

Change-Id: Iba4fcb82dd18e8c1f22d0ce3358078c5263c77dc
blueprint: add-support-for-vgpu

commit_message:
Add cluster-show to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the cluster-show command.

The trove command cluster-show is now:
    openstack database cluster show

Change-Id: I7021a0bf7fedaa5bbaa4979709b6a1de005b1db3
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

commit_message:
Now OSC server create check keys in --nic

Now OSC command to create server will check all the keys in --nic
and throws an exception if the key is invalid key.

Change-Id: I5482da0ae63d6d4298aa614e4d09bb0547da9ec3
Closes-Bug: #1681411
(cherry picked from commit fcafd987b0143a08eff964f1e988a3aaa40ad824)

messages:
[{'account_id': 25638, 'date': '2017-12-04 06:12:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6735, 'date': '2017-12-04 09:10:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Can you explain why this is needed?  I see that the majority of OpenStack packages are not listed here, including other packages that have devstack plugins.

Note that you have typo'ed os-xenapi three times in the commit message."}, {'account_id': 25638, 'date': '2017-12-04 09:57:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi, Bob. If we set "DEST"(for example: /opt/stack/openstack) in local.conf to specify the install destination of the openstack, there would be an error in install_plugin because scripts can't find os-xenapi in /opt/stack/openstack folder. Add this flag could help to download and locate os-xenpai in the folder'}, {'account_id': 25638, 'date': '2017-12-04 09:58:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Will check if we have another way to fix it.'}, {'account_id': 17920, 'date': '2017-12-07 02:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 25638, 'date': '2017-12-07 05:39:51.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Just move DEST flag to "[[local|localrc]]" section will fix the issue.'}]

commit_message:
xenapi: Add GITDIR for os-xenpai plugin

os-xenpai is a plugin for xenserver support in devstack. Add
os-xenpai GITDIR to support xenserver plugin search when stack
install.

Change-Id: I81ec7a85475b3881290a8a8d03b0faf6a7c01111

in ceilometer's db.py unit test.

Change-Id: I3781dace1dfc64467ab059742133cd189276a3e2

commit_message:
Ceilometer mitaka-eol

Change the test-requirements to use the mitaka-eol branch, as
the stable/mitaka branch no longer exists in Ceilometer.
Also limit the oslotest to < 2.0.0 to avoid a mockpatch issue
in ceilometer's db.py unit test.

Also capping the monasca-client to avoid picking up Pike version.

This echos the change made to master branch in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/518414/

Change-Id: I3781dace1dfc64467ab059742133cd189276a3e2

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the backup-show command.

The trove command backup-show is now:
    openstack database backup show

Change-Id: I2f8a4c9c9df1ca68c5746acd272e80d7d9eda364
Partially-Implements: trove-support-in-python-openstackclient

subject: Update zone migration strategy spec
messages: [{'account_id': 13111, 'date': '2017-12-06 07:08:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2017-12-06 12:08:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nGood updates'}, {'account_id': 19457, 'date': '2017-12-07 04:46:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 07:08:19.000000000', 'message': 'Update zone migration strategy spec

* Update efficacy indicators and specs.

  Because audit can not know actual number of instances migrated in
  previous audits, this patch updates LiveInstanceMigrateCount
  means the number of instances should be live migrated in each
  audit. live_instance_migrate_ratio is also updated to
  PlannedLiveInstanceMigrateCount / LiveInstanceMigrateCount.
  Cold migration, volume migration, and volume update were also
  updated as the same way.

* Update how to prioritize instances and volumes.

  The strategy chooses instances in descending order of one of the
  list. To choosing volumes is also updated as the same manner.

* Remove changing migration parallel number by network workload.

  The number of actions to be run in parallel per node or pool is
  given by the input parameter and not vary from now on.

Change-Id: I740e13ec235d80b55f38582906132a01b90387a6
'}]
commit_message:
Update zone migration strategy spec

* Update efficacy indicators and specs.

  Because audit can not know actual number of instances migrated in
  previous audits, this patch updates LiveInstanceMigrateCount
  means the number of instances should be live migrated in each
  audit. live_instance_migrate_ratio is also updated to
  PlannedLiveInstanceMigrateCount / LiveInstanceMigrateCount.
  Cold migration, volume migration, and volume update were also
  updated as the same way.

* Update how to prioritize instances and volumes.

  The strategy chooses instances in descending order of one of the
  list. To choosing volumes is also updated as the same manner.

* Remove changing migration parallel number by network workload.

  The number of actions to be run in parallel per node or pool is
  given by the input parameter and not vary from now on.

Change-Id: I740e13ec235d80b55f38582906132a01b90387a6

commit_message:
Enable the ansible deploy interface out of box

This new deploy interface works by SSHing into IPA and using ansible to
orchestrate all deployment actions.

Change-Id: Ic697d50710a9ad92f70386b8dd74019e8cd5320b
Implements: blueprint ansible-deploy

subject: Remove -U from pip install
messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2017-12-02 18:26:28.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2017-12-02 20:01:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2017-12-06 21:27:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 18:26:28.000000000', 'message': "Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I86415b6de6725f3fac361b5dbf9414ccb12e17f9
"}]
commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I86415b6de6725f3fac361b5dbf9414ccb12e17f9

messages: [{'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2017-11-27 21:03:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2017-11-27 21:05:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-11-29 00:22:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2017-12-06 20:53:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-27 21:03:15.000000000', 'message': "Don't assume single sub_node in nic config

This nic config only works when there is one sub_node since we were
cat'ing /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private expecting to get a single IP
back. Instead, cat /etc/nodepool/node_private which will be the IP
address of the given sub_node.

Change-Id: I4958170b77838ea57c8f27531f70bf8d7a44302e
"}, {'created': '2017-11-27 21:05:34.000000000', 'message': "Don't assume single sub_node in nic config

This nic config only works when there is one sub_node since we were
cat'ing /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private expecting to get a single IP
back. Instead, cat /etc/nodepool/node_private which will be the IP
address of the given sub_node.

Change-Id: I4958170b77838ea57c8f27531f70bf8d7a44302e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't assume single sub_node in nic config

This nic config only works when there is one sub_node since we were
cat'ing /etc/nodepool/sub_nodes_private expecting to get a single IP
back. Instead, cat /etc/nodepool/node_private which will be the IP
address of the given sub_node.

Change-Id: I4958170b77838ea57c8f27531f70bf8d7a44302e

commit_message:
Users can only edit users with full permission

* A user should only be able to edit a user when they have
  permission accross all of that users roles.

Change-Id: Ia69a40f6113ee36c0d3c58281a729f3390d69a86

commit_message:
Docs: Updated developer documentation to use -infra repo

This PS updates the developer documentation to make use
of the openstack-helm-infra repo and new developer
environment.

Implements: blueprint developer-environment

Change-Id: I45b627f78b9504dc0abfbe7d0061ea3475ee4748

commit_message:
Bump Max version to 3.46

Bump max version in client directly as
the client changes are not needed.

1. 3.46: support create bootable volume from nova
         0 size image.

Change-Id: Ib0cf2d88e55006c10b873327ccc85dca2dd09769

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 03:38:07.000000000', 'message': 'Disable token caching

* Token caching can cause errors when a user is removed from a
  project when they have a still valid token for it.
* Default was to cache for 5 minutes

Change-Id: I70b05f6a09b195dd87452689eb6e211d812fc8c8
Closes-Bug:1736304
'}, {'created': '2017-12-06 20:44:13.000000000', 'message': 'Selectively disable token caching

* Token caching can cause errors when a user is removed from a
  project when they have a still valid token for it.
* Default was to cache for 5 minutes
* This adds a setting in the conf file that will set the cache
  time.
* -1 Disables the cache

Change-Id: I70b05f6a09b195dd87452689eb6e211d812fc8c8
Closes-Bug:1736304
'}, {'created': '2017-12-07 01:57:00.000000000', 'message': 'Selectively disable token caching

* Token caching can cause errors when a user is removed from a
  project when they have a still valid token for it.
* Default was to cache for 5 minutes
* This adds a setting in the conf file that will set the cache
  time.
* -1 Disables the cache

Closes-Bug:1736304
'}, {'created': '2017-12-07 02:39:28.000000000', 'message': 'Selectively disable token caching

* This adds a setting in the conf file that will set the cache
  time.
* -1 Disables the cache

Change-Id: I70b05f6a09b195dd87452689eb6e211d812fc8c8
Closes-Bug:1736304
'}]
commit_message:
Selectively disable token caching

* Token caching can cause errors when a user is removed from a
  project when they have a still valid token for it.
* Default was to cache for 5 minutes
* This adds a setting in the conf file that will set the cache
  time.
* -1 Disables the cache

Change-Id: I70b05f6a09b195dd87452689eb6e211d812fc8c8
Closes-Bug:1736304

commit_message:
Remove member role assignment

"add_user_to_project" and "remove_user_from_project" are only
used for V2. This patch removed these two useless functions.

Change-Id: I94f7573997035c4395ec77eabe0d6e45ff9c3bf7

commit_message:
Link to tasks panel in notifications

* Adjutant-UI now supports views for Tasks, we should link to
  it in the default notification templates.
* To make this possible, and other potential uses, deprecate
  the TOKEN_SUBMISSION_URL in favor of HORIZON_URL
* clean up some formatting issues with the notification template

Change-Id: I1419fafe94812e64a0b3984f9f38528ec67ac8e4

commit_message:
Add retry logic mechanism

Added retry logic mechanism and added them to the API calls
where ironic presently attempts to pull an exclusive
lock on the baremetal node.

Change-Id: Ia6fbc9eec612793b3214d7883e0552913a088d5d

commit_message:
Change assert(Not)Equals to assert(Not)Equal

According to http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html
assert(Not)Equals is a deprecated alias of assert(Not)Equal.

Change-Id: If552f49edaeb3e3c387e47aa62add902c6fa6c52
Closes-Bug: #1329757

commit_message:
QNAP: Add support for QES 1.1.4

This patch do the following changes to the QNAP Manila driver:
1. Add support for QNAP QES firmware 1.1.4.
2. Correct the default parameters in edit share function.
2. Remove unused code flow.
4. Add more debug log and write more test cases.

    Implements: blueprint support-qes-114

Change-Id: I977ef3e66a21a52116b44059ad5aeaf1560b47b7

commit_message:
Do not send email when logs are not available

As per request, do not send email when there's no logs available,
since it's useless.

Change-Id: I709c3a11928dc8469e02eade4c6af4842e6d6b12
Closes-Bug: #1736273

[{'created': '2017-12-06 01:59:58.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Allow deleting all of docker cache"

commit_message:
Move remove_uwsgi_config to cleanup_placement

It had been in stop_placement, but we don't want it there: the old
side of grenade needs to call that but should not remove the uwsgi
configuration when doing so. It is configuration, after all.

Change-Id: Iee763adf7895145d97b184924896db3f1f48a015
Partial-Bug: #1736385

ACTIVE-ACTIVE: Initial distributor driver

This patch is the initial implementation of a distributor driver for
Octavia Active/Active topology support.

This patch is a decompostion of the following patch:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/313006

Task: 5836

Co-Authored-By: Valeria Perelman <perelman@il.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Move remove_uwsgi_config to cleanup_placement

It had been in stop_placement, but we don't want it there: the old
side of grenade needs to call that but should not remove the uwsgi
configuration when doing so. It is configuration, after all.

commit_message:
Improve function execution performance

- Improve/Simplify python runtime
- Use non-locking for communication with db when invoking function.
- Add config option to run job handler.
- Pre-fetch runtime when query function in db.

Change-Id: I9e791aecf03d5bf64a39548e6c9bad1b678882af

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 21:40:33.000000000', 'message': 'fix command handling in tox-log-command.sh

Exit with an error if the pipeline produces an error and run the correct
command rather than the part of the command name used for the output
filename.

Change-Id: I0754ab219983cad3eb8dae327a5435d094f8cf85
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix command handling in tox-log-command.sh

Exit with an error if the pipeline produces an error and run the correct
command rather than the part of the command name used for the output
filename.

Change-Id: I0754ab219983cad3eb8dae327a5435d094f8cf85
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Monasca-api didn't move to sphinx document creation until Pike.
To allow an exception for stable/ocata builds, remove the
publish-openstack-sphinx-docs template and put in equivalent
job listings, with branches: lines to exclude stable/ocata.

This can be reverted once Ocata reaches EOL.

Change-Id: I862d90aec2a94c6939ccc6823a854b68981b8adb

commit_message:
monasca-api: Exclude stable/ocata from sphinx doc creation

Monasca-api didn't move to sphinx document creation until Pike.
To allow an exception for stable/ocata builds, remove the
publish-openstack-sphinx-docs template and put in equivalent
job listings, with branches: lines to exclude stable/ocata.

This can be reverted once Ocata reaches EOL.

Change-Id: I862d90aec2a94c6939ccc6823a854b68981b8adb

logstash file.

commit_message:
Remove default for --overcloud-ssh-key

The default value for --overcloud-ssh-key was wrong (it was actually a
username). Instead of using a default value at all, just remove the
default since we can't sanely pick one.

Change-Id: I57a7293f0cc08b0fab0ee7c2f0b4c0a8b2bd2f44
Closes-Bug: #1736606

commit_message:
Fix wrong path in ssh selinux issue detection.

I also make sure that if grep fail it doesn't make the whole
installation fails.

Change-Id: Ib5873383632a1141c8dd3859b34ca29904020790
Closes-Bug: #1736246

by using a tebroker. This is problematic if we want to reproduce
jobs exactly (modulo provisioning the environment).

This patch adds the ability to use a pre-provisioned OVB
environment to run the toci_gate_test script against.

Change-Id: I3256838cb636de6fe1e87fd08784b087abba89e2
'}]
commit_message:
Allow running toci_gate_test on pre-provisioned ovb env

Currently we can only run toci_gate_test on an ovb environment
by using a tebroker. This is problematic if we want to reproduce
jobs exactly (modulo provisioning the environment).

This patch adds the ability to use a pre-provisioned OVB
environment to run the toci_gate_test script against.

Change-Id: I3256838cb636de6fe1e87fd08784b087abba89e2

commit_message:
Add IPSEC composable service

This service is tied to the external_deploy_tasks (such as the k8s
service); and it deploys IPSEC in the overcloud.

bp ipsec

Change-Id: Ie3b7af92c0ec97241de6d8badec13b9e93ee9305

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-06-21 15:01:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix swiftclient creation

somewhere along the way we lost most of swiftclient options in a belief
that those are handled by the keystoneauth session passes to
swiftclient.

In fact though, swiftclient only uses the session to get itself an
endpoint and a token, but is has no SessionClient, and does not use that
passed in session to make further requests to swift itself.

This patch restores all the logic that we had to decompose the session
object loaded from config to options that are passed to swiftclient
explicitly.

Change-Id: I08f382aa9d2ad22f7dbd65f7b54a8dd0a765ba44
