commit_message:
Fix swiftclient creation

in the change I52f1386df45ebe0a43b11fe1583e012dfa3af532
we lost most of swiftclient options in a belief that those are handled
by the keystoneauth session passed to the swiftclient.

In fact though, swiftclient only uses this session to get itself an
endpoint and a token, but it has no SessionClient, and does not use that
passed in session to make further requests to swift itself.

This patch restores all the logic that we had to decompose the session
object loaded from config to options that are passed to swiftclient
explicitly.

Change-Id: I08f382aa9d2ad22f7dbd65f7b54a8dd0a765ba44
Partial-Bug: #1699547
Closes-Bug: #1736158

Just one question, why placing this role here? Shouldn't it belong to tripleo-ci infra related playbooks? Ot quickstart, if it's going beyond CI only cases?"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2017-12-05 16:21:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Introduce tripleo-bootstrap Ansible role

This role will be used to prepare an environment that will deploy
TripleO.
For now, it'll just deploy 2 packages by default.

Change-Id: I560273be2ebe3a49ff37e3682222706939e5d879

commit_message:
Update the Docker registry defaults to rdoproject

The rdoproject registry should be used by default.
The upstream release files are updated in the
depends-on review to use the Docker defaults.

Related-Bug: 1732477
Depends-On: I363a0fa5742a02d267a93bc5db1dc72a4b2fe414
Change-Id: I35607572fcf4bf3e53ed15ceb1c624053b5a7572

commit_message:
Improve message information for translation

Some error messages aren't fully compatible for a
translation in an other language.
This patch change few messages to allow a better translation.

Change-Id: Iab3d470133f500eb9e9daa5996ca54c6b36be5e3

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9562, 'date': '2017-08-24 19:48:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

FYI, I re-proposed the new attach spec for Queens: https://review.openstack.org/497552

We already merged a few patches and left begin_detaching as is. As it is an API level call to put the volume into 'detaching' state it can conveniently live together with the new flow as well. I think we can drop this update for now and consider changes for multi-attach if needed, when we get there.

Thanks,
Ildik"}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-12-06 21:51:27.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-04-23 22:31:33.000000000', 'message': 'Update cinder-new-attach-apis spec for begin_detaching

The question of how the begin_detaching call is going to
be used for new style attachments and the volume detach
flow came up in I91b9a60268354ffbed86b1e7d173906cfd7b97bd.

While not required for this blueprint, we wanted to capture
the outcome of the discussion for when we eventually support
volume multiattach.

Related to blueprint cinder-new-attach-apis

Change-Id: I6bf5cefa6be0d8fba4589d18e662b5180483fae4
'}]
commit_message:
Update cinder-new-attach-apis spec for begin_detaching

The question of how the begin_detaching call is going to
be used for new style attachments and the volume detach
flow came up in I91b9a60268354ffbed86b1e7d173906cfd7b97bd.

While not required for this blueprint, we wanted to capture
the outcome of the discussion for when we eventually support
volume multiattach.

Related to blueprint cinder-new-attach-apis

Change-Id: I6bf5cefa6be0d8fba4589d18e662b5180483fae4

[{'created': '2017-12-06 12:37:26.000000000', 'message': "Bump roles SHA

This patch updates the keystone role to its latest available stable SHA.

This update is done out of the release cycle to pull down stability
fixes within the roles. The change is required to ensure we're
not being faced with pyldap breakage when building dependencies.

Change-Id: I5b9067c184bcfffe9f0588a5c4084316dd8b6d4f
"}]
commit_message:
Bump roles SHA

This patch updates the keystone role to its latest available stable SHA.

This update is done out of the release cycle to pull down stability
fixes within the roles. The change is required to ensure we're
not being faced with pyldap breakage when building dependencies.

Change-Id: I5b9067c184bcfffe9f0588a5c4084316dd8b6d4f

commit_message:
Remove docs jobs from tripleo-upgrade

We use tripleo-docs for all of our documentation so we don't want a docs
job for the tripleo-upgrade changes.

Change-Id: I6c926ba853c44c6b7e20908ef3ba344814ad87c8

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 16:31:56.000000000', 'message': "test-log-collect.sh: Use sudo to check container's root directory

Regular users can't check whether /proc/$CONTAINER_PID/root exist
since it's normally only accessible by root so run the test command
using 'sudo'

Change-Id: I95997b697f85a223d22b1d0a5ad2b6237193fb89
"}]
commit_message:
test-log-collect.sh: Use sudo to check container's root directory

Regular users can't check whether /proc/$CONTAINER_PID/root exist
since it's normally only accessible by root so run the test command
using 'sudo'

Change-Id: I95997b697f85a223d22b1d0a5ad2b6237193fb89

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 15:37:05.000000000', 'message': 'SUSE: Drop OBS repositories for openSUSE Leap < 42.3

We were installing additional repos for the apt-cacher-ng and
liberasurecode packages which are only necessary for Leap < 42.3.
However, < 42.3 is now EOL so lets drop these repositories since we
can fetch these packages from the default repos in 42.3

Change-Id: I4ba16ea660907c3fb481a9e80d73b750c2f4c138
'}]
commit_message:
SUSE: Drop OBS repositories for openSUSE Leap < 42.3

We were installing additional repos for the apt-cacher-ng and
liberasurecode packages which are only necessary for Leap < 42.3.
However, < 42.3 is now EOL so lets drop these repositories since we
can fetch these packages from the default repos in 42.3

Change-Id: I4ba16ea660907c3fb481a9e80d73b750c2f4c138

commit_message:
Add example for using external resources

Add template for show cases that how we can use external resources.
external resources in stack does not required to be modified or depends
on the stack.
blueprint external-resources

Depends-On: I8b33c957a7185a0f52356f412b13609ba1a7b469
Change-Id: Ia56318508caf43a7da28bd479becdc602477cad5

commit_message:
Add fixed_key parameter under key_manager section in cinder conf

This change is necessary for uploading an encrypted volume to glance.

Change-Id: I0975fc0c49ec243025d076f0406e28c4f5522d3a

(1 comment)

Known issues with failover calls:
1. loadbalancers do not recover from ERROR provisioning_status
2. Client throws a TypeError upon retrieval of the call's None response. The error originates from cliff and/or osc_lib.
Both issues are unlikely to be resolved within octaviacilent repo alone."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2017-11-30 15:02:28.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(14 comments)

I encourage you to break up this in 5 patches:

1. lb failover
2. lb amphora
3. filter
4. --vip-qos-policy-id
5. rename api

Great additions you're proposing!"}, {'account_id': 25239, 'date': '2017-11-30 16:45:01.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from 521569 to Client feature rain'}, {'account_id': 25239, 'date': '2017-11-30 17:16:20.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from Client feature rain to Client_feature_rain'}, {'account_id': 25239, 'date': '2017-11-30 19:19:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-23 21:50:19.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Add a bunch of features to Octavia client

* Filter list listeners or pools, by loadbalancer IDs.
Multiple IDs can be sumbitted in the same request.
This patch depends on Octavia API support, which is not
implemented as of yet.
* Add --vip-qos-policy-id option in loadbalancer create and update.
* Add loadbalancer failover option.

Task: 5742
Story: 2001224

Task: 5864
Story: 2001310

Depends-On: I1b4da3f32a9b58ed85f2abc462dee4d55b8afd47

Change-Id: I7c38471073d8990de054def3d1d99f2c0524c26e
'}, {'created': '2017-11-27 00:27:31.000000000', 'message': "Complement Octavia client with a set of features

* Allow to filter 'list' calls.

* Add --vip-qos-policy-id argument in loadbalancer create and update.
* Rename API internally, from load_balancer_v2 to Octavia.

commit_message:
Complement Octavia client with a set of features

* Commands added: loadbalancer failover, loadbalancer amphora.
* Allow to filter 'list' calls.
e.g. list all pools that correspond with a given loadbalancer ID.
* Rename API internally, from load_balancer_v2 to Octavia.

Task: 5742
Story: 2001224

Change-Id: I7c38471073d8990de054def3d1d99f2c0524c26e

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 20:00:52.000000000', 'message': 'Bump os_keystone SHA to avoid repo build failures

This commit advances the os_keystone SHA to consume a fix for LP#1736241.
Prior to this commit, Newton builds failed during the repo build with:

Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement pyasn1>=0.3.7 (from
python-ldap) (from versions: 0.1.9) No matching distribution found for
pyasn1>=0.3.7 (from python-ldap)

Change-Id: I2bf20796405cd9c841df4ebc610484ff3cb8ab4e

commit_message:
Bump os_keystone SHA to avoid repo build failures

This commit advances the os_keystone SHA to consume a fix for LP#1736241.
Prior to this commit, Newton builds failed during the repo build with:

Could not find a version that satisfies the requirement pyasn1>=0.3.7 (from
python-ldap) (from versions: 0.1.9) No matching distribution found for
pyasn1>=0.3.7 (from python-ldap)

Change-Id: I2bf20796405cd9c841df4ebc610484ff3cb8ab4e
Closes-bug: #1736789

Move policy into code

This commit registers default policies in code. For the
Register and Document Policy in Code community goal.

bp policy-and-docs-in-code

Closes-Bug: 1724714

commit_message:
zuul: add irrelevant-files section to job

This adds the 'irrelevant-files' section to the job
networking-generic-switch-tempest-dsvm-dlm. If all the
changes are in this list, the job is not run.

Change-Id: I89ae9892f66441be9889658ffaa7c44a88da75c7
(cherry picked from commit 5f445ba99c817236efae59e61308f2604bff0575)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 17:21:07.000000000', 'message': "tasks: repo_build_install: Do not retry installing distro packages

We are installing packages from the distribution repositories so there
is not much point in retrying to install them if the first attempt
failed since it's very unlikely for the repo to change state between
two attempts. Moreover, we drop the 'force' option for SUSE since we are
not switching package vendors anymore

Change-Id: I89093c2e8d10b5b5355728e7507d70fd01844ea5
"}, {'created': '2017-12-06 17:37:31.000000000', 'message': "tasks: repo_build_install: Drop 'force' argument from zypper

We are not switching package vendors anymore so we should drop the
'force' argument from zypper.

Change-Id: I89093c2e8d10b5b5355728e7507d70fd01844ea5
"}]
commit_message:
tasks: repo_build_install: Drop 'force' argument from zypper

We are not switching package vendors anymore so we should drop the
'force' argument from zypper.

Change-Id: I89093c2e8d10b5b5355728e7507d70fd01844ea5

commit_message:
Remove MysqlRootPassword from overcloud.yaml

... the password is now generated among other passwords in
tripleo-common.

commit_message:
Simplify the way drivers report support for ipv6

Driver shouldn't have to report support for ipv6 in two
places. Drivers that assert ipv6_implemented=True just
need to implement get_configured_ip_versions. Likewise
ipv4 support is computed by the same method.

Closes-bug: #1734127

Change-Id: I382767918a65b91e99ac1e604304ad01fac332e6

commit_message:
Add show to OSC

This change adds database support to the python-openstackclient
project for the show command.

The trove command show is now:
    openstack database instance show

Change-Id: I18580a7cc3394cecede18c15dc2fa9027ea842ba

commit_message:
Fix doubling allocations on rebuild

Commit 984dd8ad6add4523d93c7ce5a666a32233e02e34 makes a rebuild
with a new image go through the scheduler again to validate the
image against the instance.host (we rebuild to the same host that
the instance already lives on). This fixes the subsequent doubling
of allocations that will occur by skipping the claim process if
a policy-only scheduler check is being performed.

Closes-Bug: #1732976

Related-CVE: CVE-2017-17051
Related-OSSA: OSSA-2017-006

Change-Id: I8a9157bc76ba1068ab966c4abdbb147c500604a8

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-03 16:33:11.000000000', 'message': 'Add workaround for openstacksdk in check_libs_from_git

python-openstacksdk does not match its pip name which is openstacksdk.
So setting python-openstacksdk in LIBS_FROM_GIT leads to devstack
thinking there is a problem.

Put in a workaround for now. It would be better to either:

  a) rename python-openstacksdk repo to openstacksdk
  b) rename the pip name for openstacksdk back to python-openstacksdk
  c) add general support in the various GIT hashes for a pip name

Change-Id: I57cf95763d54ad2060a4ce2af91c3ba18ca04db0
'}]
commit_message:
Add workaround for openstacksdk in check_libs_from_git

python-openstacksdk does not match its pip name which is openstacksdk.
So setting python-openstacksdk in LIBS_FROM_GIT leads to devstack
thinking there is a problem.

Put in a workaround for now. It would be better to either:

  a) rename python-openstacksdk repo to openstacksdk
  b) rename the pip name for openstacksdk back to python-openstacksdk
  c) add general support in the various GIT hashes for a pip name

Change-Id: I57cf95763d54ad2060a4ce2af91c3ba18ca04db0

commit_message:
Extend loadbalancer_create valid VIP parameters combinations

Octavia client was incoherent with Octavia's api-ref, hence it
supported only a subset of the possible combinations for specifying
VIP parameters in loadbalancer_create.

Validation functions were updated and moved from utils.py to
validate.py and load_balancer.py, accompanied by new unit tests.

Aesthetics: Refined loadabalancer's and l7Policy's creation synopses.

Task: 5825
Task: 5828
Story: 2001279

Change-Id: I1b4da3f32a9b58ed85f2abc462dee4d55b8afd47

(2 comments)

General issues:
1. Excluding list_quota, project_id is required by the API, instead of being inferred from context by default.
One of the outcomes of this behavior is that it puts show_quota in a weird spot, because I cannot find any real benefit for it over list_quota, which currently returns the same result for the same parameters.
2. Is there a way to reset to default quota?
e.g. quota set --listener default --loadbalancer 5
or: quota defaults set'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2017-11-21 18:21:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Add Quota client API and OSC support

Includes list, show, set and reset of quotas, and show quota defaults.

As per OSC CLI guidelines, long options names shall not use underscore
but single dashes internally between words. ChangeId
Iaf7d251ef4054fa28ef61e02fdebc05c83786e9e will address the newly added
--loadbalancer option for quota setting.

DocImpact
Task: 5751
Task: 5752
Task: 5753
Task: 5754
Task: 5755
Story: 2001235

Change-Id: I336477e723867b5da2a041b441a25a7a611596ee

commit_message:
Remove redundancy code

When we pass secret_mode and kek_datum_model to
EndcryptedDatum [1], the __init__ function of
the class set secret_id attribute [2]. So no need
to have the line of code #346 [3]

[1] https://github.com/openstack/barbican/blob/master/barbican/plugin/store_crypto.py#L312
[2] https://github.com/openstack/barbican/blob/master/barbican/model/models.py#L457
[3] https://github.com/openstack/barbican/blob/master/barbican/plugin/store_crypto.py#L316

Change-Id: Ia419dccfc73aba88d4e00384a0a11926781bfeb3

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I85d256e9e66bbf940f5b645c4a887b1f2a3707de

commit_message:
Generate correct name for Sahara cluster

Sahara has certain requirements for cluster names. The autogenerated
name may previously have ended up invalid, if a resource name contained
an incompatible character (for example underscore).

Also adding some missed constraints to Sahara cluster name, borrowed
from Sahara template name constraints.

Change-Id: If1358a104beb831d04d4012e64cd1afedce5a7dd
Closes-Bug: #1718989
Related-Bug: #1472998

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 20:31:55.000000000', 'message': 'Speed up event listing with nested stacks

When handling the command "openstack stack event list --nested-depth=n", we
obtain the list of nested stacks by querying the database for all resources
that share the root stack ID. However, since all we're getting is the stack
IDs, there's no need to query all of the fields and construct a versioned
object for each resource. Just get the set of stack IDs.

Change-Id: I12155433e2ac1af919aa4b5e780fb965cd5885d8
Related-Bug: #1588561
'}]
commit_message:
Speed up event listing with nested stacks

When handling the command "openstack stack event list --nested-depth=n", we
obtain the list of nested stacks by querying the database for all resources
that share the root stack ID. However, since all we're getting is the stack
IDs, there's no need to query all of the fields and construct a versioned
object for each resource. Just get the set of stack IDs.

Change-Id: I12155433e2ac1af919aa4b5e780fb965cd5885d8
Related-Bug: #1588561

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 17:48:21.000000000', 'message': 'Stop kolla-kubernetes pike nova-libvirt containers crashing.

Deploying Nova libvirt container with Kolla kubernetes
and pike images has not been possible as the nova-libvirt
container constantly crashes - causing nova api and other
services to not come up.

The issues are a combination of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492552
and other missing TLS/Qemu issues previously fixed in
kolla-ansible but not ported to kolla-kubernetes.

In particular, turn listen_tls off, and make sure using kvm or
qemu appropriately. However if TLS is enabled, make sure the correct
SSL header is used.

Change-Id: I9424ddb2757139999b8b575bec27ed435b3d26da
closes-bug: 1733806
'}, {'created': '2017-11-28 18:49:41.000000000', 'message': 'Stop kolla-kubernetes pike nova-libvirt containers crashing.

kolla-kubernetes changes:

Deploying Nova libvirt container with Kolla kubernetes
and pike images has not been possible as the nova-libvirt
container constantly crashes - causing nova api and other
services to not come up.

The issues are a combination of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492552
and other missing TLS/Qemu issues previously fixed in
kolla-ansible but not ported to kolla-kubernetes.

In particular, turn listen_tls off, and make sure using kvm or
qemu appropriately. However if TLS is enabled, make sure the correct
SSL header is used.

ko.py changes:

A series of small fixups - primarily to handle libvirt better,
as a result of debugging and fixing libvirt nova issues.

Two new options to edit globals.yaml and cloud.yaml.

Updated default versions for helm and k8s.

Various additions to change and fix bugs.

Cleaner info output at beginning.

nova.conf additions as per deployment guide.

Remove libvirt running on host as well as nasty apparmor.

Feature: give user the options of specifying their own docker
repo. Very useful for running with own images.

closes-bug: 1733806

Change-Id: I9424ddb2757139999b8b575bec27ed435b3d26da

commit_message:
Stop kolla-kubernetes pike nova-libvirt containers crashing.

kolla-kubernetes changes:

Deploying Nova libvirt container with Kolla kubernetes
and pike images has not been possible as the nova-libvirt
container constantly crashes - causing nova api and other
services to not come up.

The issues are a combination of https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492552
and other missing TLS/Qemu issues previously fixed in
kolla-ansible but not ported to kolla-kubernetes.

In particular, turn listen_tls off, and make sure using kvm or
qemu appropriately. However if TLS is enabled, make sure the correct
SSL header is used.

ko.py changes:

A series of small fixups - primarily to handle libvirt better,
as a result of debugging and fixing libvirt nova issues.

Two new options to edit globals.yaml and cloud.yaml.

Updated default versions for helm and k8s.

Various additions to change and fix bugs.

Cleaner info output at beginning.

nova.conf additions as per deployment guide.

Remove libvirt running on host as well as nasty apparmor.

Feature: give user the options of specifying their own docker
repo. Very useful for running with own images.

closes-bug: 1733806

Change-Id: I9424ddb2757139999b8b575bec27ed435b3d26da

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 16:07:38.000000000', 'message': "SUSE: Refresh zypper repositories if necessary

When we change the status of the repositories it's best if we refresh
the metadata in order to ensure that everything is in a sensible state.
Moreover, we shouldn't autorefresh the 'repo-oss' repository since it's
frozen right after the openSUSE release.

Change-Id: I1ca13d85f8a275ff93c8c12fab1833dc2e50f6fb
"}]
commit_message:
SUSE: Refresh zypper repositories if necessary

When we change the status of the repositories it's best if we refresh
the metadata in order to ensure that everything is in a sensible state.
Moreover, we shouldn't autorefresh the 'repo-oss' repository since it's
frozen right after the openSUSE release.

Change-Id: I1ca13d85f8a275ff93c8c12fab1833dc2e50f6fb

Remove osapi_v21 project_id_regex

This has been deprecated since 13.0.0.

Change-Id: I975faf1d9b05cc3142960bc1c6e9c5f1c6810bf8
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Added swift version to recon cli

Show swift version and check if the same on hosts by using
`swift-recon --swift-version`.

Ex:
$ swift-recon --swift-versions

Versions matched (2.7.1.dev144), 0 error[s] while checking hosts.

or if differs

Versions not matched (2.7.1.dev144, 2.7.1.dev145),
0 error[s] while checking hosts.

Change-Id: I3c2e569f0c44168333251bb58bab4b5582e15a45

commit_message:
Remove workaround for periodic jobs

We run now periodic jobs as promotion jobs only, no need to use
different release files for them.

Change-Id: I47d25b062347f55d180f5e53781c5a29b51e1381

commit_message:
Add Bionic and remove Zesty series and tests

Bionic, being the next LTS, is important to enable for dev
and test as early as possible ahead of 18.02.

Zesty goes EOL in Jan 2018. The next stable charms release (18.02)
will not provide Zesty series support, as it was an interim
(non-LTS) release.

Change-Id: Ie4189fab0c8ce04f60ada98ec94de98f2a79e302

commit_message:
Add missing dependency for release job

If we have a dependencies on jobs, the job needs to be run as well.
Fix problems.

Change-Id: Ia799fe4188b7543a0a0a7edf68e36611d3c7b22d

[{'created': '2017-12-04 22:50:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix path in selinux fix for /root/.ssh

In the original change Ifc76d3717f4f214f9f3d55ccbafdbcc0180c31c1 the
find is attempting to use /home/.ssh to see if the selinux context needs
to be updated for /root/.ssh. Because this path is wrong, it actually

Change-Id: I3b5032cfbac9daecc5f3f0e7e8af54b14d91d5cb

find is attempting to use /home/.ssh to see if the selinux context needs
to be updated for /root/.ssh. Because this path is wrong, it actually

commit_message:
Fix path in selinux fix for /root/.ssh

In the original change Ifc76d3717f4f214f9f3d55ccbafdbcc0180c31c1 the
find is attempting to use /home/.ssh to see if the selinux context needs
to be updated for /root/.ssh. Because this path is wrong, it actually
causes the install to fail when enforcing is enabled.

Change-Id: I3b5032cfbac9daecc5f3f0e7e8af54b14d91d5cb
Closes-Bug: #1736246
Related-Bug: #1711564

commit_message:
Utilize LimitingReader for staging data

ImageSizeLimitExceeded exception block is unreachable in stage
call because glance is using sotre_backend.add (filesystem.add
in this case) and it will raise 'exceptions.StorageFull()' [1]
if image file is too large (errno.EFBIG).

Used LimitingReader to enforce the image size limitation which
will raise ImageSizeLimitExceeded if image size is larger that
config option 'image_size_cap'.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/glance_store/blob/master/glance_store/_drivers/filesystem.py#L691

Change-Id: I50821111ac4c782966ed1ccd48e92f8dd4100e62
Closes-Bug: #1732830

[{'created': '2017-11-02 18:43:26.000000000', 'message': "Better handle missing files in _construct_from_data_file

There's a window between when we list the files on disk and when we actually
try to open the .data file where another process could delete it. That should
raise a DiskFileNotExist error, not an IOError.

commit_message:
Better handle missing files in _construct_from_data_file

There's a window between when we list the files on disk and when we actually
try to open the .data file where another process could delete it. That should
raise a DiskFileNotExist error, not an IOError.

Change-Id: I1b43fef35949cb6f71997874e4e6b7646eeec8fe
Closes-Bug: 1712662

commit_message:
Add a new check to volume attach

With the new Cinder volume attach API we can attach the same volume
to the same instance multiple times. This is useful for live migrate
however in other cases we would like to avoid this to happen.

This patch adds a new check in Nova and fail the volume attach request
in case this condition is met.

Change-Id: I049f00f993e45eeb090a1e1a5e5696cf2f103187

commit_message:
Fix bug in setting dns servers

We are adding the full list of ips in each entry, instead
of adding the item of the iteration.

Change-Id: Ib09abad83669b93f1bb9116686451e47280bd108
Fixes-Bug: #1719864
(cherry picked from commit 71a794949aac61fd684cc32119f22de4d5965489)

commit_message:
Add description of domain_id in creating user/group

This patch add descriptions of domain id in creating user/group api.
When creating a user/group, if domain_id is not specified, the
Identity service implementation will get domain id from token.

Change-Id: I30efed239243a63788d72745326379c877060c40

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I7fd1b0f0d01b105318c23e3286915196c2cb8424

[{'created': '2017-12-04 08:04:32.000000000', 'message': 'Correct error message for request token

When create a request token with header "requested_project_id",
Keystone raise the 400 error:
"Expecting to find requested_project_id in request".
The correct key is "Requested-Project-Id" which is case sensitive.
This patch correct the misleading error message.

Change-Id: I2e619a2e7326d0c84756efbdce36d99b0bfbfc56
'}, {'created': '2017-12-05 00:53:44.000000000', 'message': 'Correct error message for request token

When create a request token with header "requested_project_id",
Keystone raise the 400 error:
"Expecting to find requested_project_id in request".

The correct key is "Requested-Project-Id" which use - instead of _

This patch correct the misleading error message.

Change-Id: I2e619a2e7326d0c84756efbdce36d99b0bfbfc56
'}]
commit_message:
Correct error message for request token

When create a request token with header "requested_project_id",
Keystone raise the 400 error:
"Expecting to find requested_project_id in request".

The correct key is "Requested-Project-Id" which use - instead of _

This patch correct the misleading error message.

Change-Id: I2e619a2e7326d0c84756efbdce36d99b0bfbfc56

commit_message:
[rally] use the proper task file name

rally ci scripts selects the task file to launch based on the name of
the job.
Since the job's name finishes by mistral-task, the rally task file
should be named as mistral-task.yaml

Change-Id: Ib4548dc2541f7ba766d23f589679ae350b901fa6

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I4e847f5ec2eb8ab9ff552618985b88bc1b4f8aca

commit_message:
zypper: fix package removal

zypper only supports the --no-recommends option during installs, giving
the option during removals results in an error.

When setting ACTION=remove, remove --no-recommends from EXTRA_ARGS, and
set --clean-deps to also remove no-longer-needed dependencies.

Rename EXTRA_ARGS to ACTION_ARGS for increased readability.

Change-Id: Ifbd168992b1a20658b6b4a99ba175234f6c78f6d

commit_message:
Update scanario004 to use ceph-ansible

This patch updates scanario004 from using puppet-ceph to using
ceph-ansible for service configuration.

The upstream container image needs the following PR merged:
https://github.com/ceph/ceph-docker/pull/737

Change-Id: I2c31c471a46187e14d5f91e2fbd501dd5f0ddc5d
Depends-On: I0392726372934a0530e692dbc77a205ce0919ff1
Depends-On: I6992310544caa63cec570ec01a980af1c8b312cc

commit_message:
Enforce policy on oslo-context

Up to now, middleware/auth.py was overwriting the oslo
context generated from keystonemiddleware with a
dictionary that simulated the values of
oslo-context directly pulled out of the token.

As oslo-context gains logic, Keystone has started
to diverge from the rest of the projects that use
oslo-context.

Change-Id: Ie93392f8aabddf8c963b9cb08aaa006d28d37e22

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 12:01:57.000000000', 'message': "Fix inspector not found when noauth

Recently released ironic-inspector-client v3.0.0 no longer has a meaningful
default for 'inspector_url' argument - its default is None and in this
case endpoint resolution from keystone catalog is attempted.

This means that in bifrost we should now set explicit endpoint for
inspector in ironic's config file for noauth case.

Change-Id: I9948a3edc8e297059005bdb4065796c30003ee63
"}]
commit_message:
Fix inspector not found when noauth

Recently released ironic-inspector-client v3.0.0 no longer has a meaningful
default for 'inspector_url' argument - its default is None and in this
case endpoint resolution from keystone catalog is attempted.

This means that in bifrost we should now set explicit endpoint for
inspector in ironic's config file for noauth case.

Change-Id: I9948a3edc8e297059005bdb4065796c30003ee63

commit_message:
Fix Kibana plugin config duplication

This commit fixes the problem of the Kibana plugin's instances
list getting appended to every time monasca-setup runs. See
the referenced story for details. It also adds a cautionary
note on avoiding the problem to plugin development
documentation.

Change-Id: I7c82028ad31798dcfe88e77c97c41da87c9743fa
Story: 2001311
Task: 5865
(cherry picked from commit 530599c705f52ed4d7082833df0df77a609ef4db)
(cherry picked from commit 26bf5050a110763b9cdeb379cfe14b8ebac3c74a)

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I9b14274aee2c19e8a12ee48a129b62f5f6c67c57

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I0da75950181e24e84bcd3e925a47ba06e6cd40bd

subject: Fix regression for bare metal nodes
messages: [{'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2017-12-06 10:32:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2017-12-06 10:50:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nLooks sensible to me'}, {'account_id': 25747, 'date': '2017-12-06 11:33:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13095, 'date': '2017-12-06 14:06:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-06 10:32:26.000000000', 'message': 'Fix regression for bare metal nodes

When running on bare metal, the log folders are created in advance
to /openstack/log/aio1-memcached in a /var/log/memcached link.

The task ``Create memcached log dir`` would then fail with:
``/var/log/memcached already exists as a link``,
because the folder exists, and the exit 1 after the chown
would trigger.

This replaces the code with a more idempotent code:
If a change would be detected by chown -c, it would be listed
in the stdout, while the rc would still be 0.
An error in chown would still be rc != 0.

So we can use this different state to mark the task as changed
or not, and handle the create folder case when no folder exists.

Change-Id: I904f13d2ae02cd410edc4aaeb83bedd1e14d69fb
'}]
commit_message:
Fix regression for bare metal nodes

When running on bare metal, the log folders are created in advance
to /openstack/log/aio1-memcached in a /var/log/memcached link.

The task ``Create memcached log dir`` would then fail with:
``/var/log/memcached already exists as a link``,
because the folder exists, and the exit 1 after the chown
would trigger.

This replaces the code with a more idempotent code:
If a change would be detected by chown -c, it would be listed
in the stdout, while the rc would still be 0.
An error in chown would still be rc != 0.

So we can use this different state to mark the task as changed
or not, and handle the create folder case when no folder exists.

Change-Id: I904f13d2ae02cd410edc4aaeb83bedd1e14d69fb

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: Ib894a4a99bef001183b892fcf53708f5d699db4d

commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: Ife6a6d88f636057f87d47fe79af8bfcff897ccc1

commit_message:
Use get_rpc_transport instead of get_transport

With the added get_rpc_transport() function in oslo.messaging [1]
and the recent version bump of oslo.messaging to 5.24.2, we can
safely replace get_transport() with get_rpc_transport() which is much
cleaner.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/454194/

Change-Id: I2ff713f91032952239fc79b1c83b7bc0d33ccab0

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-02 18:27:26.000000000', 'message': "Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I67288f12bc125c12d124cd1dcfeff5ec70975d48
"}]
commit_message:
Remove -U from pip install

'pip install -U' ugrades specified packages, this is not necessary
since we use constraints, remove the parameter '-U' from the line.

With tools/tox_install.sh - which a previous change of mine removed -
the -U was not harmful, but with the current set up, it might cause
upgrades, so remove it.

Change-Id: I67288f12bc125c12d124cd1dcfeff5ec70975d48

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-07 01:19:22.000000000', 'message': 'ovs-fw: catches exception from ovsdb

e.g. OVS agent will be arised exception when deleting
multiple vms in bulk. Nova will delete tap by libvirt
when removed vms at first. Then, ovs agent check ovs_port
by "self.get_ovs_port", and the exception will be raised.
The patch catches exception caused by inconsistency coming
from ovsdb.

Change-Id: Ief7de22e5f85253d8a25ecfbb139a8f87c1a0b35
Closes-Bug: #1729213
'}, {'created': '2017-11-07 04:50:42.000000000', 'message': 'ovs-fw: catches exception from ovsdb

e.g. OVS agent will be arised exception when deleting
multiple vms in bulk. Nova will delete tap by libvirt
when removed vms at first. Then, ovs agent check ovs_port
by "self.get_ovs_port", and the exception will be raised.
The patch catches exception caused by inconsistency coming
from ovsdb.

commit_message:
ovs-fw: catches exception from ovsdb

OVS agent will raise an exception when deleting
multiple vms in bulk. Nova will delete tap when vms are
removed. Then, ovs agent checks ovs_port
by calling "self.get_ovs_port", and the exception will be raised.
The patch will catch exception.

Change-Id: Ief7de22e5f85253d8a25ecfbb139a8f87c1a0b35
Closes-Bug: #1729213

Enable ironic staging drivers in the undercloud

This is needed to use the oVirt driver for testing and virtual controllers.

Implements: blueprint ovirt-driver
Depends-On: I89da8187c2c549ad2f6d569890080ce144be46c0

Ceph cluster plugin

This change adds a ceph plugin to collect metrics regarding
ceph clusters. Includes documentation, detection and tests.

Change-Id: Ia4b61e751f0f8087fc9ab3adff889734b8afc2d6
(cherry picked from commit 612492c774822e21e01ec7abf430e53991108561)

commit_message:
Update capabilities-map.yaml to include latest storage environments

* updated Ceph features to use environments from ceph-ansible
* added docker-ha.yaml as HA option
* added containers-deafult-parameters.yaml

Closes-Bug: 1735214
Change-Id: I5845e8ca5212a0b97c21d6e44db0e0a1ddfc23fc

commit_message:
Fix PEP8 in gate

Zuul openstack-tox-pep8 failed due to several errors [1]
- Use bare except.
- Use ambiguous variable name 'l'. As pycodestyle doc [2] mentioned,
'Never use the characters 'l', 'O', or 'I' as variable names.'.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/96/477396/3/gate/openstack-tox-pep8/f851c2d/ara/result/57b145af-a103-4982-9e9c-7c93c21b32df/
[2] https://pep8.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/pycodestyle.html

Change-Id: Iefdf10245a64e58fa6b5d8174a09fb90f18c81a8

commit_message:
Configure tep-ip for genius auto tunnels

Configure tunnel endpoint (tep) ip so that genius
auto tunnels will work. Genius auto tunnels will
be the default for oxygen and later releases.

Change-Id: Icc0397e4e69386cbf8ca0cd705f8f367eaaa01b6
Signed-off-by: Victor Pickard <vpickard@redhat.com>

subject: Allow raw Grafana links
messages: [{'account_id': 12542, 'date': '2017-12-05 10:54:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12542, 'date': '2017-12-06 13:39:09.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nI discussed this with Witek and he is not really happy with backporting to stable/pike, so abandoning for now.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 10:54:07.000000000', 'message': 'Allow raw Grafana links

This commit introduces two configuration changes:

* The 'raw' attribute for links in GRAFANA_LINKS which allows
  the user to point the dashboard URLs specified through
  GRAFANA_LINKS at arbitrary paths or URLs without further
  modification. This is False by default, which means the
  'fileName' and 'path' attributes are considered to be
  database or JSON file names to be inserted into a URL.
* The SHOW_GRAFANA_HOME setting which controls whether the
  "Grafana Home" button is displayed or not. By default this
  is True and the button is shown.

Change-Id: I55660f91fd56eb22dd7ad4674af422aeb2ba2ea3
(cherry picked from commit 8aa1cccf29fdbba7fabaa3634ef534ac86267c1e)
'}]
commit_message:
Allow raw Grafana links

This commit introduces two configuration changes:

* The 'raw' attribute for links in GRAFANA_LINKS which allows
  the user to point the dashboard URLs specified through
  GRAFANA_LINKS at arbitrary paths or URLs without further
  modification. This is False by default, which means the
  'fileName' and 'path' attributes are considered to be
  database or JSON file names to be inserted into a URL.
* The SHOW_GRAFANA_HOME setting which controls whether the
  "Grafana Home" button is displayed or not. By default this
  is True and the button is shown.

Change-Id: I55660f91fd56eb22dd7ad4674af422aeb2ba2ea3
(cherry picked from commit 8aa1cccf29fdbba7fabaa3634ef534ac86267c1e)

commit_message:
Update the service_token_roles_required to True

AuthToken middleware is set with
keystone_authtoken.service_token_roles_required set to False.
This is backwards compatible but deprecated behaviour.
This patch set it to True.

Change-Id: If44cc7e10073e1dde49a26fd38387caa10035dae

commit_message:
Align tox_install.sh with other projects

pip_install.sh is renamed to tox_install.sh to align with other projects.

The tox_install.sh here behaves a bit differently than the others, which
is causing some problems when trying to rework some of the shared gate jobs.
Align it to the form used in other repos.

Change-Id: Ie35d2b33f4bfaa8383c7af9e5ca489b61f7da073

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-01 15:24:12.000000000', 'message': "Fix codec error when format=csv

The Py2 version of the csv module cannot accept unicode text. In Py2
we replaced the csv module with the unicodecsv module which encodes
unicode text prior to calling the standard Py2 csv module. Thus when
the cvs formatted output is emitted on stdout it is presented as a
encoded byte stream. But stdout has been replaced with a StreamWriter
which encodes to the desired encoding. The problem is the StreamWriter
attempts to encode all objects passed to it's write function,
including str objects. Instead it should only encode unicode text objects
and allow bytes to pass through unmodified.

This patch adds an override of the codecs.getwriter function which
only encodes unicode text objects. In addtion we pass the encoding
value obtained from the stream to the unicodecsv writer.

The patch fixes the codec error when outputing csv formated text that
contains a non-ASCII character. The unicodecsv implmentation will emit
byte encoded str objects to the stream. When the core StreamWriter
attempts to encode a str object Python will first promote the str
object to a unicode object. The promotion of str to unicode requires
the str bytes to be decoded. However the encoding associated with the
str object is not known therefore Python applies the default-encoding
which is ASCII. In the case where the str object contains utf-8
encoded non-ASCII characters a decoding error is raised. By not
attempting to encode a byte stream we avoid this error.

A more complete discussion of the above issues can be found here:

https://github.com/fedora-infra/kitchen/blob/develop/kitchen2/docs/unicode-frustrations.rst#frustration-4-now-it-doesnt-take-byte-strings

Change-Id: I22b5ad8bf0e227ec75a2a36986f0487191f7cbc2
Closes-Bug: 1720115
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2017-10-02 23:29:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix codec error when format=csv

commit_message:
Fix codec error when format=csv

The Py2 version of the csv module cannot accept unicode text. In Py2
we replaced the csv module with the unicodecsv module which encodes
unicode text prior to calling the standard Py2 csv module. Thus when
the cvs formatted output is emitted on stdout it is presented as a
encoded byte stream. But stdout has been replaced with a StreamWriter
which encodes to the desired encoding. The problem is the StreamWriter
attempts to encode all objects passed to it's write function,
including str objects. Instead it should only encode unicode text objects
and allow bytes to pass through unmodified.

This patch adds an override of the codecs.getwriter function which
only encodes unicode text objects. In addtion we pass the encoding
value obtained from the stream to the unicodecsv writer.

The patch fixes the codec error when outputing csv formated text that
contains a non-ASCII character. The unicodecsv implmentation will emit
byte encoded str objects to the stream. When the core StreamWriter
attempts to encode a str object Python will first promote the str
object to a unicode object. The promotion of str to unicode requires
the str bytes to be decoded. However the encoding associated with the
str object is not known therefore Python applies the default-encoding
which is ASCII. In the case where the str object contains utf-8
encoded non-ASCII characters a decoding error is raised. By not
attempting to encode a byte stream we avoid this error.

A more complete discussion of the above issues can be found here:

https://github.com/fedora-infra/kitchen/blob/develop/kitchen2/docs/unicode-frustrations.rst#frustration-4-now-it-doesnt-take-byte-strings

Change-Id: I22b5ad8bf0e227ec75a2a36986f0487191f7cbc2
Closes-Bug: 1720115
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-05 13:10:07.000000000', 'message': "Fix vmops issue when managing virtual interfaces

The nova-compute service was unable to start because an exception
was propagating from the 'HyperVVIFDriver' class.

More specific, the 'plug' method from the 'HypervVIFDrive' class
would throw an exception if it could not properly plug the virtual
interface.

This exception is now caught inside the 'plug_vifs' method of the
'compute-hyperv' driver.

This change fixes the issue.

Change-Id: Ibaa405577d4fa06f27fdd9440aca49be0c620af5
Closes-bug: #1736392
"}, {'created': '2017-12-06 11:46:59.000000000', 'message': "Raise proper exception in case of vif plug errors

The Nova Compute manager expects a VirtualInterfacePlugException
exception to be raised when a vif plug fails.

This particularly affects the service initialization step. If we're
raising an exception other than the above mentioned one, the exception
won't be cought, in which case the Nova Compute service will stop.

This change ensures that we're raising the expected exception if vif
plugging fails.

Change-Id: Ibaa405577d4fa06f27fdd9440aca49be0c620af5
Closes-bug: #1736392
"}]
commit_message:
Raise proper exception in case of vif plug errors

The Nova Compute manager expects a VirtualInterfacePlugException
exception to be raised when a vif plug fails.

This particularly affects the service initialization step. If we're
raising an exception other than the above mentioned one, the exception
won't be cought, in which case the Nova Compute service will stop.

This change ensures that we're raising the expected exception if vif
plugging fails.

Change-Id: Ibaa405577d4fa06f27fdd9440aca49be0c620af5
Closes-bug: #1736392

commit_message:
Split instance_list into instance and multi_cell

This cleans up the previous refactor by splitting out the common pieces
to multi_cell_list.py. Since the functional tests are still instance-specific,
we leave that file in place, but rename the unit test file and pull the
instance quirks test out to the dedicated test class.

Change-Id: Ia7018a987070a2f60540b1638c4e133eb3a99825

This makes it possible to implement a class for the thing you want to
list and sort across cells. Basically it makes the efficient instance
listing stuff modular enough to be usable (in a very similar pattern)
with other data types.

Change-Id: I50a192d61a701252a6d07207c6e6ca88384c2877
'}, {'created': '2017-11-30 17:44:23.000000000', 'message': 'Genericify the instance_list stuff

list and sort across cells. Basically it makes the efficient instance
listing stuff modular enough to be usable (in a very similar pattern)

commit_message:
Genericify the instance_list stuff

This makes it possible to implement a class for the thing you want to
list and sort across cells. Basically it makes the efficient instance
listing stuff modular enough to be usable (in a very similar pattern)
with other data types.

Change-Id: I50a192d61a701252a6d07207c6e6ca88384c2877

commit_message:
Fix retrieving barbican endpoint from service catalog

The context wrapper classes under castellan.common.credentials were
missing an auth_url property resulting in calls to get_endpoint()
failing with 'Could not determine a suitable URL for the plugin' unless
users set barbican/auth_endpoint.

Change-Id: I1be3a1e11e3f4c2170062927ad359bf679eb25d9
Closes-Bug: #1497993

commit_message:
Create tripleo passwords file for the deployment

The password file will be create only if the password generation
is enabled (which is the default option). By disabling it, using
--disable-password-generation will not create this file.
Closes-Bug: #1677537

Change-Id: I3a5c3f1f3d66434b9e369ba22d2d3a4faf2f60ac

commit_message:
Add --ansible-opts for upgrade-non-controller.sh O->P upgrade

This allows the operator to pass extra options to the invocation
of ansible-playbook. In particular this can be used to skip the
validation tasks using the --skip-tags option, for example:
--ansible-opts "--skip-tags validation -vvv" to skip validation
and enable verbose logging

Change-Id: If4690d86904554cece641ec8ba87880201e14679
Closes-Bug: 1735731

commit_message:
Change assert(Not)Equals to assert(Not)Equal

According to http://docs.python.org/2/library/unittest.html
assert(Not)Equals is a deprecated alias of assert(Not)Equal.

Change-Id: I25738e6de2230e8971b2f8d4000c234e2a07a851
Closes-Bug: #1329757

[{'created': '2017-12-04 21:25:18.000000000', 'message': 'Explicitly pull images before docker run

By pulling any missing required images, a pull failure will result in
an early failure with a clear cause. For detached containers, this is
improved error handling than having a container which fails
to start.

Change-Id: Ifa0257cbeadd3da9be756edf6a729c90141c238f
Closes-Bug: #1733941
(cherry picked from commit 9b2ae8bd9665fce38e38aa99dbc4716f20dc2146)
'}]
commit_message:
Explicitly pull images before docker run

By pulling any missing required images, a pull failure will result in
an early failure with a clear cause. For detached containers, this is
improved error handling than having a container which fails
to start.

Change-Id: Ifa0257cbeadd3da9be756edf6a729c90141c238f
Closes-Bug: #1733941
(cherry picked from commit 9b2ae8bd9665fce38e38aa99dbc4716f20dc2146)

https://docs.python.org/3/library/logging.html#logging.warning

commit_message:
Add #openstack-dev mention and channel list

This patch adds suggested channels to start in when IRC setup
is completed. After the summit discussion about the first contact
sig, it was suggested that we funnel new comers into the #openstack-dev
channel. This patch also links to the master list of irc channels.

Change-Id: I37dc374523ffaf169736448749edb4d751ee8459

commit_message:
Add new repo for mistral tempest plugin

In addition to fulfilling Queens Goal "Split Tempest Plugins into
Separate Repos/Projects", This imports from a temporary github
repo that preserves the history of the plugin and additionally
applies the openstack cookiecutter to it.

Change-Id: I61ba384e25c860d245efe042d0bfc92cb6af89ea
Needed-By: I26e55c2414325530178d125b385a6fa634ef954a

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-20 19:34:44.000000000', 'message': 'Eager-load properties for nested resource list

When doing "openstack stack resource list --nested-depth=n", we were
lazy-loading the resources' properties data. This is expensive, especially
when there are a large number of resources. Eager-load the data, as we
always use it to show the resources.

For consistency, always eager-load the resource 'data' (even in
resource_get), because the Resource versioned object accesses it
unconditionally.

Change-Id: Idb871fddf77bf24828878c315e19e200c28841be
Related-Bug: #1665503
'}]
commit_message:
Eager-load properties for nested resource list

When doing "openstack stack resource list --nested-depth=n", we were
lazy-loading the resources' properties data. This is expensive, especially
when there are a large number of resources. Eager-load the data, as we
always use it to show the resources.

For consistency, always eager-load the resource 'data' (even in
resource_get), because the Resource versioned object accesses it
unconditionally.

Change-Id: Idb871fddf77bf24828878c315e19e200c28841be
Related-Bug: #1665503

[{'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2017-05-17 17:11:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8864, 'date': '2017-05-17 17:35:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

We already test method signatures in almost all of the virt drivers with test_public_api_signatures - present in ironic's, hyperv's, xenapi's, vmwareapi's, libvirt's and fake's test_driver.py. PowerVM is missing from that list, and I do like this more centralized approach, but the existing tests definitely need to be taken into account somehow (either by removing them in favour of what you're doing here, or adapting this patch to use them, or whatever)"}, {'account_id': 20040, 'date': '2017-05-17 18:28:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Well done.  Looks good to me.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-05-11 14:08:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think it is worth first trying this before going the searchlight way. If we can make this work, we remove a lot of potential fragility that comes into the system via the searchlight-based solution.

I think feeding searchlight the notifications and having that as an interface is _great_, and I think having more services is not a big deal, but making it a requirement where the complexity of managing the synchronization of information is high is dubious.

Especially if we can make it reasonable using Programming.'}, {'account_id': 11816, 'date': '2017-05-12 16:18:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

(2 comments)

a few comments really quick but haven't combed through this carefully.  I think from our discussion yesterday I got most of the gist pretty well (huge argument for working together in an office rather than remote.... :( )"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2017-05-16 13:45:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Matt are you moving forward with this now, or are you waiting for more feedback? I vote the former.'}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2017-05-16 14:25:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I'll move forward with it. Enough people seem to have looked that hopefully anything truly egregious would have been spotted."}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2017-05-22 23:22:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Matt, awesome ideas and innovative use of heapq.merge(). Nice :)'}, {'account_id': 23882, 'date': '2017-05-26 16:55:55.000000000', 'content': 'Removed the following votes:

* Code-Review+1 by Dan Peschman <dpeschman@godaddy.com>
'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2017-07-12 18:29:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Any update on this? Without this in Pike we'll have a pretty severe caveat on cellsv2 usage."}, {'account_id': 9555, 'date': '2017-07-13 15:27:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-09 20:11:23.000000000', 'message': "DISCUSSION: Implement multi-cell instance sort/filter/pagination

This is extended pseudocode for discussion only. It implies a couple of
refactors which aren't done. Imagine they are. It's syntactically
incorrect. The intention is that it could be written something like
this, although the code would be a whole lot cleaner and probably in
different places.

This is an implementation of instance filter and sort across multiple
cells. To explain how it works, lets say we've got 5 cells and we're
limiting to 50 returned instances. We start by creating 5 db queries,
one for each cell. Each individual db query will return instances sorted
by the given sort criteria, limited to 50 returned rows.

In the API we define a parallel python function which does the same
sort, and use this to produce a merge sort iterator over our 5 db
queries. We pop the top 50 entries off the merged iterator. Note that
because we're iterating directly over the SQLA queries, across all 5
cells we're still only pull out a maximum of 50 objects, not 250.  Our
python sort only ever operates on a maximum of 50 objects. The sort
itself is constant memory. As before we end up instantiating 50 objects
in memory.

Pagination also works exactly as it did before. Note that our pagination
works by using an instance object as a comparator(*). Essentially we
pull out the instance object, fetch all values we use as sort keys and
then construct a new query which starts after those values. The
multi-cell implementation works in exactly the same way. The API fetches
the marker instance first from whichever cell it's in. Then we use this
object to construct our start-after-here values for all cells. So when
we're called for page 2, each of our 5 cells again is asked for the
first 50 rows greater than the marker object. It doesn't matter that the
marker object isn't actually in 4 of them.

The cost of this implementation is that now every cell does the same
amount of work that a single cell would have done. There is a tiny
computational overhead in the api service.

(*) I think there might be a bug in this pagination method, but it's not
introduced by this patch. If you were sorting on name and you've got 100
instances all called 'foo', if we resume at (name > 'foo') we'll lose a
whole page full of foo.

Change-Id: I6da01c566924f9209c4d8673027c4a44f9e1271b
"}]
commit_message:
DISCUSSION: Implement multi-cell instance sort/filter/pagination

This is extended pseudocode for discussion only. It implies a couple of
refactors which aren't done. Imagine they are. It's syntactically
incorrect. The intention is that it could be written something like
this, although the code would be a whole lot cleaner and probably in
different places.

This is an implementation of instance filter and sort across multiple
cells. To explain how it works, lets say we've got 5 cells and we're
limiting to 50 returned instances. We start by creating 5 db queries,
one for each cell. Each individual db query will return instances sorted
by the given sort criteria, limited to 50 returned rows.

In the API we define a parallel python function which does the same
sort, and use this to produce a merge sort iterator over our 5 db
queries. We pop the top 50 entries off the merged iterator. Note that
because we're iterating directly over the SQLA queries, across all 5
cells we're still only pull out a maximum of 50 objects, not 250.  Our
python sort only ever operates on a maximum of 50 objects. The sort
itself is constant memory. As before we end up instantiating 50 objects
in memory.

Pagination also works exactly as it did before. Note that our pagination
works by using an instance object as a comparator(*). Essentially we
pull out the instance object, fetch all values we use as sort keys and
then construct a new query which starts after those values. The
multi-cell implementation works in exactly the same way. The API fetches
the marker instance first from whichever cell it's in. Then we use this
object to construct our start-after-here values for all cells. So when
we're called for page 2, each of our 5 cells again is asked for the
first 50 rows greater than the marker object. It doesn't matter that the
marker object isn't actually in 4 of them.

The cost of this implementation is that now every cell does the same
amount of work that a single cell would have done. There is a tiny
computational overhead in the api service.

(*) I think there might be a bug in this pagination method, but it's not
introduced by this patch. If you were sorting on name and you've got 100
instances all called 'foo', if we resume at (name > 'foo') we'll lose a
whole page full of foo.

Change-Id: I6da01c566924f9209c4d8673027c4a44f9e1271b

[{'created': '2017-11-30 10:34:29.000000000', 'message': "Add uuid field to BlockDeviceMapping

Add a uuid field which the libvirt driver will use to populate a
persistent serial number for local disks.

This is somewhat complicated by the two different uses of
BlockDeviceMapping. The API creates 'anonymous' BDM objects which can
be applied to any instance. These don't have an id field, which is
generated by the db, and also don't have a uuid.

In modifying tests, we model the above by ensuring that we add a uuid
to test data anywhere there is also an id, as that is persistent data,
or anywhere which calls the db api directly. We don't add it
elsewhere. All existing tests are therefore contrived to assume that
uuid is fully populated in the DB. We add new tests for the handling of
the legacy case.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: I564fcf8167c77a92cd009934a867bdc5c59c9452

commit_message:
Add uuid field to BlockDeviceMapping

Add a uuid field which the libvirt driver will use to populate a
persistent serial number for local disks.

This is somewhat complicated by the two different uses of
BlockDeviceMapping. The API creates 'anonymous' BDM objects which can
be applied to any instance. These don't have an id field, which is
generated by the db, and also don't have a uuid.

In modifying tests, we model the above by ensuring that we add a uuid
to test data anywhere there is also an id, as that is persistent data,
or anywhere which calls the db api directly. We don't add it
elsewhere. All existing tests are therefore contrived to assume that
uuid is fully populated in the DB. We add new tests for the handling of
the legacy case.

Part of bp local-disk-serial-numbers

Change-Id: I564fcf8167c77a92cd009934a867bdc5c59c9452

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-28 06:34:40.000000000', 'message': "Ignore resources with non-existent template

When listing resources with nested depth, we get all resources
for the root stack and cache them in the context. By the time
we iterate through the resources for a nested stack, if the
current_template_id of resources do not match the stack template,
we try to load the template. However, it's possible that the
template does not exist anymore. It would be good to ignore
those resources.

Change-Id: I838320539838ed74f490bca8601cde96eaf7c7ee
Closes-Bug: #1734815
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore resources with non-existent template

When listing resources with nested depth, we get all resources
for the root stack and cache them in the context. By the time
we iterate through the resources for a nested stack, if the
current_template_id of resources do not match the stack template,
we try to load the template. However, it's possible that the
template does not exist anymore. It would be good to ignore
those resources.

Change-Id: I838320539838ed74f490bca8601cde96eaf7c7ee
Closes-Bug: #1734815

Nova will always use an unqualified host name for an instance's
compute node. If monasca-agent is configured to use a compute
node's fully qualified host name for metrics and that gets used for
looking up the instances running on that node, Nova will return

commit_message:
libvirt check: use unqualified hostname

Nova will always use an unqualified host name for an instance's
compute node. If monasca-agent is configured to use a compute
node's fully qualified host name for metrics and that gets used for
looking up the instances running on that node, Nova will return
zero results. This commit fixes this problem by always reducing
the the host name to its first component.

Change-Id: Ie29cb2dc305c8b2d4c551d1512e0e755f9e38cb6
Story: 2001251
Task: 5781
(cherry picked from commit 95c7976b50e4fde2c92e1d04d92734021f069f94)

commit_message:
Don't use oslo context get_logging_values

get_logging_values has been changed recently to not pass the token
anymore, call to_dict as expected.

Change-Id: I3a7f1293a4d0082274af270f86b5c732d898f8bc
Closes-Bug: #1733345
(cherry picked from commit a944cdb98e9c026d04cf08011172622890a9b51f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-16 17:20:41.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Fail fast if changing image on a volume-backed server rebuild

We don't support changing the image in the root disk of a volume-backed
server during a rebuild. The API will change the instance.image_ref
attribute to the newly supplied image_href to the rebuild API but the
actual image used by the server after the rebuild will be the original
image, which is wrong. We need to just fail fast in this case in the API
since the compute service doesn't support it. See the related mailing list
discussion for more details:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123255.html

Change-Id: If4c5fb782bb7e7714fb44f8ca9875121e066bc10
Closes-Bug: #1482040
"}, {'created': '2017-11-17 17:48:49.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Fail fast if changing image on a volume-backed server rebuild

We don't support changing the image in the root disk of a volume-backed
server during a rebuild. The API will change the instance.image_ref
attribute to the newly supplied image_href to the rebuild API but the
actual image used by the server after the rebuild will be the original
image, which is wrong. We need to just fail fast in this case in the API
since the compute service doesn't support it. See the related mailing list
discussion for more details:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123255.html

Co-Authored-By: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
Change-Id: If4c5fb782bb7e7714fb44f8ca9875121e066bc10
Closes-Bug: #1482040
Closes-Bug: #1732947
"}, {'created': '2017-11-17 17:52:45.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Fail fast if changing image on a volume-backed server rebuild

We don't support changing the image in the root disk of a volume-backed
server during a rebuild. The API will change the instance.image_ref
attribute to the newly supplied image_href to the rebuild API but the
actual image used by the server after the rebuild will be the original
image, which is wrong. We need to just fail fast in this case in the API
since the compute service doesn't support it. See the related mailing list
discussion for more details:

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123255.html

Co-Authored-By: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
Change-Id: If4c5fb782bb7e7714fb44f8ca9875121e066bc10
Closes-Bug: #1482040
Closes-Bug: #1732947
"}, {'created': '2017-11-17 19:28:47.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Fail fast if changing image on a volume-backed server rebuild

We don't support changing the image in the root disk of a volume-backed
server during a rebuild. The API will change the instance.image_ref
attribute to the newly supplied image_href to the rebuild API but the
actual image used by the server after the rebuild will be the original
image, which is wrong.

We need to just fail fast in this case in the API since the compute
service doesn't support it. We also need to ensure that instance.image_ref
doesn't get modified since a missing value here is used by novaclient and
probably other HTTP API users as an indication of a volume-backed server.

See the related mailing list discussion for more details:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123255.html

Co-Authored-By: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
Change-Id: If4c5fb782bb7e7714fb44f8ca9875121e066bc10
Closes-Bug: #1482040
Closes-Bug: #1732947
"}, {'created': '2017-11-19 23:24:50.000000000', 'message': "Fail fast if changing image on a volume-backed server rebuild

server during a rebuild. The API will change the instance.image_ref
attribute to the newly supplied image_href to the rebuild API but the
actual image used by the server after the rebuild will be the original
image, which is wrong.

We need to just fail fast in this case in the API since the compute
service doesn't support it. We also need to ensure that instance.image_ref
doesn't get modified since a missing value here is used by novaclient and
probably other HTTP API users as an indication of a volume-backed server.

See the related mailing list discussion for more details:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123255.html

server during a rebuild. The API will change the instance.image_ref

We need to just fail fast in this case in the API since the compute

doesn't get modified since a missing value here is used by novaclient and

commit_message:
Fail fast if changing image on a volume-backed server rebuild

We don't support changing the image in the root disk of a volume-backed
server during a rebuild. The API will change the instance.image_ref
attribute to the newly supplied image_href to the rebuild API but the
actual image used by the server after the rebuild will be the original
image, which is wrong.

We need to just fail fast in this case in the API since the compute
service doesn't support it. We also need to ensure that instance.image_ref
doesn't get modified since a missing value here is used by novaclient and
probably other HTTP API users as an indication of a volume-backed server.

See the related mailing list discussion for more details:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-October/123255.html

Co-Authored-By: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
Change-Id: If4c5fb782bb7e7714fb44f8ca9875121e066bc10
Closes-Bug: #1482040

commit_message:
Fix Kibana plugin config duplication

This commit fixes the problem of the Kibana plugin's instances
list getting appended to every time monasca-setup runs. See
the referenced story for details. It also adds a cautionary
note on avoiding the problem to plugin development
documentation.

Change-Id: I7c82028ad31798dcfe88e77c97c41da87c9743fa
Story: 2001311
Task: 5865
(cherry picked from commit 530599c705f52ed4d7082833df0df77a609ef4db)
